title: Security IT Director
description:
**Are you a visionary IT and Security Leader ready to shape the future of tech in a purpose-driven company?**

**This one's for you!**


At Trialbee, we’re transforming how patients connect with clinical research through cutting-edge technology and a human-first approach. We are now looking for a **Security IT Director** to lead and evolve our IT and security landscape in support of our ambitious growth.

  

At Trialbee, you won’t just maintain infrastructure, you’ll shape the future of secure, cloud-first technology that enables better access to clinical research worldwide.  

  

This is an opportunity to own IT strategy and information security in a company that values autonomy, trust, and innovation. You'll have the mandate to build, improve, and future-proof our tech landscape, with impact across the entire business.  

  

If you're a strategic thinker who thrives in a lean, global environment and wants to make a difference, we’d love to hear from you.


We welcome candidates across Europe.

### **How you will contribute**

In this pivotal role, you’ll drive strategic initiatives that protect and empower our global organization. From developing robust security frameworks to enhancing our IT infrastructure and employee experience, your work will directly contribute to the success of our teams and the people we serve.

* Lead and manage all aspects of Trialbee’s IT and security operations.
* Develop and implement security policies to safeguard data, systems, and infrastructure.
* Build a future-ready IT roadmap aligned with business priorities and innovation goals.
* Coordinate with vendors and third parties to ensure seamless and secure service delivery.
* Guide disaster recovery and incident response planning.
* Oversee compliance with data privacy, security regulations, and industry best practices.
* Foster a culture of security awareness across the company through training and communication.
* Manage budgets, contracts, licenses, and assets with a focus on efficiency and transparency.
* Partner across departments to implement digital tools that enhance productivity and collaboration.
* Support the People team with secure, scalable IT solutions for onboarding, engagement, and retention.

### 

### **Who are you?**

* 7+ years of progressive IT management experience in a remote or global environment.
* 3+ years of experience in an IT security leadership role.
* Strong grasp of cloud architecture, cybersecurity, risk management, and compliance.
* Proven track record of leading complex projects and cross-functional teams.
* Excellent communicator, capable of translating tech into business language.
* Experience in digital transformation, AI, data analytics, or business intelligence is a plus.
* Strategic thinker with a hands-on mindset and a drive to make things better.
* Master’s degree or certifications like **CISSP**, **CIO**, or **PMP** are a plus.

### 

### **Why join Trialbee?**


At Trialbee, we are all passionate about making a difference as we innovate the future of clinical trial patient enrollment. You will work with a dynamic team who work together in an inclusive environment across the globe.


What we offer:

* A global community of talented people working from 9 different countries
* A challenging and stimulating job in an exciting industry
* Competitive compensation package
* Flexibility
* A fast-paced, high-energy, and high-performance environment
* Social gatherings and activities
* A friendly and supportive community of team members


Ready to help transform the future of clinical research?

**Apply now** and join us on the journey.


Diversity, Equity, and InclusionWe’re an equal-opportunity company. All applicants will be considered without attention to ethnicity, appearance, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: Digital Workplace Transformation Leader - Sweden
description:
**Role** 
 – Industry Principal /Digital Workplace Transformation Leader
 



**Skill** 
 - Digital Workplace Transformation
 



**Location** 
 – Sweden
 



  





**Job Description:** 




  





 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
 



  





**Your role** 




  





 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.
 



  





**Role and Responsibilities:** 




  




* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.



  





**Required - Mandatory:** 




  





 • Experience in IT .
 



 • A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
 



 • Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
 



 • Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains –
 



 Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).
 



  





**Personal** 




  





 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
 



 • Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
 



 • Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
 



 • Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.
 



  





**Why Infosys** 




  





 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
 



  





 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

title: Senior Informations- och Cybersäkerhetskonsult med affärsområdesansvar - Castra
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*
**Rollen**
 I rollen som senior informations- och cybersäkerhetskonsult med affärsområdesansvar kommer du att få en spännande kombination av att både arbeta som konsult i skarpa uppdrag och samtidigt bygga upp samt leda affärsområdet för säkerhet inom Castra Stockholm. Du får alltså det bästa av två världar – operativt arbete och strategiskt ansvar.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med några av Sveriges mest intressanta organisationer inom offentlig och privat sektor och vara en nyckelperson i Castras fortsatta tillväxt inom säkerhet.
   

  

**I rollen kommer du:**
* Arbeta som konsult i uppdrag inom informations- och/eller cybersäkerhet
* Utföra risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser, stödja vid efterlevnad av standarder som ISO 27001, NIST och CIS
* Rådgiva i säkerhetsfrågor vid digitala transformationer och större IT-projekt
* Bygga upp och leda affärsområdet för informations- och cybersäkerhet i Stockholm
* Sätta strategi, rekrytera konsulter och bygga kundrelationer
* Driva affärer och samarbeta med kollegor från andra affärsområden inom Castra


**Erfarenhet**
* Flera års erfarenhet inom informations- och/eller cybersäkerhet
* Kompetens inom områden som GRC, incidenthantering, säkerhetsarkitektur, riskhantering eller molnsäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av standarder som ISO 27001, NIST, CIS eller liknande ramverk
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och en naturlig drivkraft att skapa affärer
* Erfarenhet av konsultrollen eller vana att arbeta nära kund
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


**Meriterande:**
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att bygga eller leda affärsområde eller team
* Certifieringar inom säkerhet, t.ex. CISSP, CISM, ISO 27001 Lead Implementer
* Bakgrund inom både teknisk och organisatorisk säkerhet
* Kunskap inom AI Act, DORA med flera.


**Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**
 Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet.
   

  

 Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser. Det låter lite skrytsamt, förlåt. Men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av Great Place to Work och har de senaste tre åren blivit utnämnda till en av Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser. Som grädde på moset är vi även Gasell- och Karriärföretag.
   

  

 På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara ytterligare ett bevis. Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Summan av kardemumman är att hos oss är möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.
   

  

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Eskilstuna, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping.*
 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**
 Sök direkt via länken eller hör av dig till semir.jasarevic@castra.se

title: IT-supportspecialister till uppdrag i Stockholm
description:
**Om uppdraget** 




 Akkodis söker nu tre erfarna konsulter till ett spännande uppdrag inom fabrikssupport med placering i Stockholm. Du kommer att bli en viktig del i ett team som arbetar med IT-support mot en verksamhet som är aktiv dygnet runt. Uppdraget innebär en bred teknisk roll med fokus på infrastruktur, databaser och nätverk.
 



 Inledningsvis kommer du att arbeta i Second Line och Second Line Extended Support för att lära dig arbetsflöden, system och processer. Därefter kommer du vara med och bygga upp en ny supportfunktion.
 



 Du kommer att tillhöra ett team om cirka 10 personer i Stockholm, med nära samarbete med kollegor på andra orter.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av slutanvändarsupport
* Gedigen kunskap inom:
* Systematisk felsökning
* Infrastruktur/Server (Windows och Linux)
* Databas/Storage
* Nätverk
* Ärendehanteringssystem
* Dokumentation
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Möjlighet att arbeta i skift samt resa vid behov



  





**Meriterande erfarenheter:** 



* Azure, Active Directory, SCCM
* ITIL, ServiceNow, IFS, Biztalk
* Print- och etikettutskriftssystem
* Certifieringar inom ovanstående områden



  





**Vi letar efter dig som:** 



* Har ett genuint supporthjärta
* Trivs i team och bidrar till en positiv arbetsmiljö
* Är lösningsorienterad och initiativtagande



  





**Viktigt att veta:** 



* Uppdraget kräver svenskt medborgarskap
* Uppdraget kräver Ifylld kompetensmatris
* Säkerhetsprövning och bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras före uppdragsstart



  





**Plats:** 
 Stockholm, Alvik
 



**Period:** 
 1 oktober 2025 – 31 december 2026
 



**Arbetstid:** 
 Skiftgång kan förekomma (support 24/7), möjlighet till visst remote-arbete
 



  





 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt – urval sker löpande!
 



  





**Om Akkodis** 




 Akkodis är en global ledare inom teknikkonsulttjänster och digital innovation. Vi förenar de bästa talangerna inom IT och Engineering för att hjälpa våra kunder att driva teknologisk utveckling och skapa framtidens lösningar.
 



  





 Med vår starka närvaro i Sverige och internationellt arbetar vi nära både offentliga och privata aktörer inom områden som försvar, industri, energi, transport och telekom. Våra konsulter är nyckeln till vår framgång – därför strävar vi efter att erbjuda meningsfulla uppdrag, kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och en arbetsmiljö där du trivs och växer.
 



  





 Genom att vara en del av Akkodis får du inte bara ett uppdrag – du blir en del av ett större sammanhang där teknik, människor och innovation möts.
 



  





**Välkommen till Akkodis – där människor och teknik möts för att skapa framtiden.**

title: Chief Information Security Officer
description:
Symetri is committed to being the partner of the future by leveraging our size, experience, and data to ensure our clients’ success, whilst meeting the complex data security and regulatory requirements of a listed company operating in both European and US markets.
 



  





**POSITION OVERVIEW** 




 The CISO is responsible for leading Symetri’s information security strategies, ensuring the protection of digital assets, data integrity, and compliance with regulatory requirements. As a key contributor, the CISO will oversee cybersecurity initiatives, risk management, IT governance, and business continuity planning, working closely with leadership to align technology and security strategies with business goals.
 



  





 Working in partnership with the Chief Data Officer, the CISO will need to find the right balance between protection of data and enabling data accessibility to drive growth and competitive advantage.
 



  





**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES** 




**Information Security Leadership** 



* Develop, implement, and oversee a comprehensive information security strategy to protect company and client data.
* Lead cybersecurity initiatives, ensuring protection against threats, vulnerabilities, and cyberattacks.
* Establish security policies, standards, and frameworks in compliance with industry regulations (e.g., ISO 27001, NIS2, NIST, GDPR, SOC 2).
* Monitor and respond to security incidents, breaches, and emerging threats, ensuring rapid mitigation and recovery.



  





**IT Strategy & Governance** 



* Working in partnership with our regional internal IT teams, oversee the IT infrastructure, ensuring reliability, scalability, and security in alignment with business objectives.
* Establish IT governance frameworks to optimize technology investments, efficiency, and innovation.
* Ensure compliance with relevant data privacy, cybersecurity, and IT regulations.
* Evaluate and implement security technologies (with regional internal IT teams), including firewalls, encryption, IAM (Identity and Access Management), and SIEM (Security Information and Event Management).



  





**Risk Management & Compliance** 



* Conduct regular security risk assessments, identifying gaps and implementing mitigation strategies.
* Work with legal and compliance teams to align IT and security policies with regulatory and contractual obligations.
* Oversee third-party risk management, ensuring vendor compliance with security standards.
* Lead internal and external audits related to IT security and compliance.



  





**Business Continuity & Incident Response** 



* Develop and maintain a robust business continuity and disaster recovery (BC/DR) plan.
* Ensure rapid incident detection, response, and recovery to minimize business impact.
* Establish a security awareness and training program for employees to reduce human-related security risks.



  





**Leadership & Collaboration** 



* Serve as a key advisor to executive leadership on IT security and risk matters.
* Collaborate with the Chief Data Officer to ensure security policies are balanced with availability of data to ensure the organisation can use data to drive competitive advantage and enhance customer experiences.
* Partner with regional internal IT teams to ensure effective rollout of agreed strategies and policies.
* Ensure employees understand their role in cybersecurity.
* Collaborate with internal departments, clients, and industry peers to strengthen security posture.



  





**QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE** 



* 10+ years of experience in IT security, cybersecurity, or information technology leadership roles.
* Proven track record of implementing security frameworks and managing enterprise security programs.
* Strong knowledge of cybersecurity technologies, cloud security, network security, and data protection.
* Experience with compliance standards such as ISO 27001, NIS2, NIST, SOC 2, GDPR, and HIPAA.
* Hands-on experience with security technologies (firewalls, intrusion detection, encryption, IAM, SIEM).
* Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CISA) strongly preferred.



  





**LOCATION** 




 Sweden or any other country in Europe where we operate (Norway, Finland, Denmark, UK and Ireland).
 



  





**APPLICATION** 




 Apply as soon as possible, we are working with ongoing selection. For questions, please contact Lars Vrennhage, HR, +46 70 952 71 28.
 



  





**ABOUT SYMETRI** 




 At Symetri, we develop and provide technical solutions and services for companies in architecture, engineering, construction, infrastructure and manufacturing. We enable companies to work smarter for a better future by ensuring access to the expertise and technology they need for efficient and sustainable work.
 



  





 We develop and distribute our own solutions and Symetri is one of Autodesk's largest solutions partners globally. Symetri has approximately 1,000 employees in 7 countries and around 400,000 daily users. Symetri is an expansive company with financial strength and is 100% owned by Addnode Group listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.

title: Vmware Consultant
description:
**Job Description:** 




  





 The candidate will be a member of an IT team (ETSS – Engineering Solutions and Support) that specializes in collaborating with HealthCare product engineering teams to provide the infrastructure and services to meet engineering objectives. This includes on-prem data centers/data rooms/labs ops, and internal support of those operations. Candidate will collaborate directly with engineering teams to understand infrastructure requirements, develop solutions with the IT team, manage solution projects, and act as a focal point for issue escalations. This candidate would also be working with various other internal IT Experts and associates for issues resolution, solution development etc.
 



 Candidate is accountable to ETSS leadership and responsible for working with Engineering teams on infrastructure related solutions and support. The skill sets listed below will be required during the engagement for various projects and support services.
 






* Must have English and Swedish speaking/writing skills to communicate
* Must be self-motivated and work independently at times
* Must have L2 experience in gathering technical requirements, producing documentation, and managing technical projects.
* Must have the ability to triage, document, troubleshoot, engage owners and support teams for operational issues and facilitate solutions.
* Must have L2+ experience with Linux administration and troubleshooting
* Must have L2 experience in a physical data center, engineering labs, familiar with racking, cabling, networking connections, inventory control.
* Must have L2 experience with networking principals, wireless concepts, IP routing and device configuration.
* Must have awareness of virtualization technologies with L1-2 experience with VMware vSphere.
* Must have L2 experience with windows administration
* Must have L2+ experience in storage administration; especially regarding backup strategy, recovery, mirroring and managing large disk arrays.
* Highly desired – L1-2 experience in lab/data center migrations/relocations
* Highly desired – L1-2 experience with identity alignments and certificates/licenses operations/technologies
* Must be able to comply with local and country laws along with site EHS standards.
* Must be able to travel between Stockholm and Linkoping sites when necessary, primary location will be Stockholm.

title: Intresseanmälan IT-supportkonsult
description:
**Vad innebär det att vara IT-supportkonsult hos oss?**
 Som IT-supporttekniker är du navet i organisationens tekniska vardag. Du ser till att användarnas system, datorer och nätverk fungerar – och att tekniken aldrig står i vägen för arbetet. Din insats gör skillnad varje dag.
   

  

 Beroende på uppdrag kan arbetsuppgifterna variera, men här är några exempel på vad du kan få göra:
   

  

* Ge förstklassig support till användare via telefon, e-post, ärendehanteringssystem och på plats.
* Felsöka problem kopplade till operativsystem, applikationer, nätverk och kontorsutrustning.
* Installera och konfigurera datorer, skrivare, mobiltelefoner och annan IT-utrustning.
* Administrera konton och rättigheter i system som Active Directory och Microsoft 365.
* Dokumentera ärenden och lösningar – du vet hur viktig struktur är i supportvärlden.
* Samarbeta med andra tekniker och IT-specialister för att lösa mer komplexa utmaningar.
* Bidra till förbättringar, rutiner och kunskapsdelning internt.


**Vad söker vi hos en IT-supportkonsult?**
 Vi letar efter dig som har:
   

  

* Yrkesutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som IT-tekniker, Onsite-tekniker eller supporttekniker, 1st eller 2nd line.
* Ett brinnande intresse för teknik och viljan att utvecklas.


 Vi ser gärna att din tekniska verktygslåda innehåller:
   

  

* Operativsystem: Windows, macOS och/eller grundläggande Linux.
* Hårdvara & nätverk: Felsökning, konfiguration, grundläggande TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPN.
* System & verktyg: Active Directory, Microsoft 365, TeamViewer, Remote Desktop.
* IT Säkerhet: Grundläggande säkerhetsprinciper – antivirus, brandväggar, säkerhetskopiering
* Skriptning (meriterande): och kanske lite PowerShell?


 Men viktigast av allt – du är tålmodig, lösningsorienterad och har ett lugnt och pedagogiskt sätt när du möter användare, även när tempot är högt. Du är trygg i din tekniska kompetens men minst lika viktig är din servicekänsla och förmåga att kommunicera lösningar på ett enkelt och förståeligt sätt. Struktur och noggrannhet är en självklarhet, särskilt när det kommer till dokumentation och processer. Att hålla dig uppdaterad på nya verktyg och arbetssätt är något du gör naturligt. Du gillar att ta ansvar, trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
   

  

 Visst låter det spännande?
   

  

 Vi vill gärna höra mer om dig och vad du brinner för inom IT-support. Skicka in din intresseanmälan idag – kanske är det just dig vi ringer när nästa spännande uppdrag kommer in.
   

  

 Vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.

title: Global IT Chief Enterprise Architect
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**We are now looking for a Global IT Chief Enterprise Architect**
 Ready to lead our enterprise architecture strategy into an important transformation journey implementing SAP and beyond?
   

  

 As Global IT Chief Enterprise Architect you are responsible for the strategic direction and management of Billerud's enterprise architecture. You ensure that our IT systems, processes, and solutions are aligned with our overall business strategy and goals - and that a well-defined target architecture exists. You will oversee the design and implementation of scalable, secure, and future-ready technology frameworks across our regions, ensuring that the IT investments deliver true business value.
   

  

 This role is pivotal in guiding our global architecture transformation, maintaining technology roadmaps and fostering innovation, while ensuring compliance with regulatory and security standards. You will chair the architectural review council and work closely with our business stakeholders. You are a part of our newly created Global IT Governance organisation, leads a small team of enterprise architects, and reports to the Director Global IT Governance.
   

  

 This role is located in Solna, Stockholm Sweden and requires some travel (5–10%) within Europe and North America to support architecture and project related activities.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Enterprise Architecture Strategy & Leadership: Lead the development and implementation of the global enterprise architecture strategy, ensuring alignment with business and IT goals.
* Technology Roadmaps and Innovation: Develop and maintain technology roadmaps that reflect the current and future state of the enterprise architecture across all business domains in all regions.
* Governance and Compliance: Establish and enforce global IT governance frameworks and architecture standards, ensuring compliance with legal, regulatory, and security requirements across regions.
* Cross-Domain Integration & Alignment: Oversee the integration of processes, data, and applications across different business domains to ensure seamless interoperability and reduce complexity.
* Project & Change Management Support: Provide architecture leadership and guidance to large-scale global IT projects, ensuring solutions align with enterprise architecture principles and roadmaps, as well as supporting ongoing initiatives to maintain architecture consistency and alignment with business needs.


 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
**To succeed in this position, we believe you have:**
* A Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Enterprise Architecture, Engineering or a related field.
* Senior experience in IT architecture, whereof several years in a managerial position – preferably in a multinational organization.
* Proven experience leading enterprise architecture initiatives at a strategic level, including ERP implementations, cloud migrations, digital transformations, large-scale IT projects.
* Practical experience as project manager or technical project lead, with a good understanding of enterprise architecture frameworks and their practical application.


**Meritorious**
* Understanding of SAP EPR landscape and systems.
* Certifications in TOGAF or similar architecture standards.


**Personal qualities**
 For us, personality is important. We believe you possess strong leadership and strategic thinking abilities, seamlessly combining a big-picture perspective with a hands-on, practical approach to problem-solving. You are business oriented and embrace change, ensuring that technology solutions align with the company goals. You have strong communication skills that enable you to collaborate effectively and influencing stakeholders at all levels. Adaptability and resilience are your strengths, allowing you to thrive in dynamic environments and maintain composure also in stressful situations.
   

  

 Our values are central in our business and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say!
   

  

**Contact**
 If you want to know more about the role you are welcome to contact David Michaud, recruiting Manager, Director Global IT Governance, david.michaud@billerud.com.
   

  

 If you want to know more about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact Alice Lundberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, alice.lundberg@billerud.com
   

  

**Application information**
 Welcome with your application no later than 1st of June. Selection may be conducted on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* You will become a key player in a newly created global IT organization.
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future.
* Development and career opportunities.
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


 Our recruitment process will contain: Interviews, recruitment test, references, alcohol- & drug tests and background check.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 41.2 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: IT-specialist
description:
**Vill du bidra till medicinsk forskning av toppkvalitet?**
 Vi söker en ambitiös och motiverad IT-specialist till en framgångsrik kardiologisk forskningsavdelning vid Karolinska Institutet. På avdelningen arbetar väletablerade forskargrupper inom ett nätverk med målsättningen att förbättra vård och behandlingar av hjärtsjukdomar. Vi söker en kompetent, erfaren och välutbildad person som vill bidra till utvecklingen genom att ansvara för en välfungerande IT-miljö.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som ansvarig för IT- och datamiljön kommer du arbeta med forskare och forskningspersonal inom avdelningens alla grupper inom klinisk, epidemiologisk och laborativ forskning. Arbetet innefattar skapande och underhåll av databaser inom olika projekt innefattande administration av Linuxserver och SQL-databashantering (RedCap). Du ansvarar för installation, felsökning och reparation av hårdvara kopplad till medicinskteknisk utrustning, och är rådgivande om lösningar för mjukvara och hårdvara. Tjänstens omfattning är 10% av heltid.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du har lång erfarenhet som IT-konsult och liknande uppdrag inom den medicinska forskningen. Du skall vara serviceinriktad och brinna för att hjälpa till i komplexa forskningsmiljöer. Du skall ha en gedigen utbildning som civilingenjör eller motsvarande och ha dokumenterad erfarenhet av administration av Linuxserver och SQL-databashantering (RedCap).
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 En kreativ, internationell och inspirerande miljö fylld av kompetens och nyfikenhet. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet. Vår vision är att driva utvecklingen av kunskap om livet och verka för en bättre hälsa för alla. Här bedriver vi framgångsrik medicinsk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar i Sverige. Som universitet är Karolinska Institutet en statlig myndighet. Det gör att du får goda förmåner genom vårt kollektivavtal. Medarbetare på KI erbjuds också möjlighet till ett flexibelt arbetssätt. Det innebär att om den verksamhet du jobbar i tillåter, så kan du arbeta en del av din arbetstid på distans. Du får även träna fritt i våra moderna friskvårdsanläggningar där utbildad personal finns på plats.
   

  

**Placering**
 Tjänsten är placerad inom Institutionen för medicin, Solna. Institutionen består av tio avdelningar och varje avdelning består av flertalet forskargrupper. Den aktuella tjänsten är placerad inom avdelningen för Kardiologi. På avdelningen bedrivs forskning inom flera stora områden innefattande klinisk, epidemiologisk, registerbaserad och translationell forskning.
   

  

* [Video om Karolinska Institutet, hur vi alla bidrar till en bättre hälsa för alla] ---


**Ansökan**
 Ansökan ska göras via rekryteringssystemet Varbi. I denna rekrytering söker du med ditt CV utan personligt brev. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du istället att få svara på några frågor om varför du söker jobbet.
   

  

 Vid tillsvidareanställning tillämpar Karolinska Institutet 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Vill du göra skillnad – och bidra till en bättre hälsa för alla? Sök jobb hos oss**
 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 10 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-2289/2025 | Kontakt: John Pernow john.pernow@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Maria Eldh, ST-OFR maria.eldh@ki.se, Farzad Hedayaty, SACO-s farzad.hedayaty@ki.se, Louisa Cheung, SACO Louisa.Cheung@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-05-28 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-13

title: Spontanansökan
description:
Hittar du ingen ledig tjänst som matchar just dig?
   

  

 Skicka in en spontanansökan till oss! Vi letar alltid efter fler personer som delar våra värderingar och vår vision att skapa ett IT-tryggare Sverige. Vi håller din ansökan för framtida behov och kontaktar dig när en passande möjlighet öppnar sig.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av något större? På IT-Total välkomnar vi talanger som brinner för att vara i teknikens framkant och vill utvecklas tillsammans med branschens främsta experter. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta i en inspirerande miljö med spetskompetens och IT-säkerhet på högsta nivå.
   

  

 Vi vill arbeta i teknikens framkant och ge dig möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i din roll och inom det område just du brinner för. Vi garanterar dig en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där vi lyfter varandra och delar med oss av våra kunskaper. Tillsammans vill vi representera något nytt genom att vara nytänkande, kundfokuserade och framtidsinriktade.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som vill bli bäst på det just du brinner för**
 Du har en ständig strävan att ligga i framkant inom ditt område och förstår värdet av att arbeta proaktivt. Du tycker om utmaningar och att jobba med teknik och kollegor i framkant. Det är viktigt att du har en bred grund att stå på inom området IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

 Här är några generella kvalifikationer som vi värdesätter:
   

  

* Vara en glad och utåtriktad person som tycker om att skapa relationer.
* Passion för IT och teknik.
* Viljan att lära sig nya tekniska färdigheter och vara med och driva IT-Total framåt.
* Nytänkande och förmåga att hitta kreativa lösningar på komplexa problem.


**IT-Total erbjuder dig**
 IT-Total föddes ur idén att vara det bästa företaget för medarbetare inom sin bransch, därför välkomnar vi dig till en arbetsplats som ger dig glädje, stimulans och möjlighet att växa inom det område du brinner för. Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som satsar på din framtid och jobbar i teknikens framkant med ett högt säkerhetstänk. Med säkerhetsprövade medarbetare och säkerhetsklassade lokaler- och datahallar garanterar vi trygghet och integritet för våra kunder.
   

  

**Varför kommer du att trivas på IT-Total?**
 IT-Total föddes ur idén att vara det bästa företaget för medarbetare inom sin bransch, därför välkomnar vi dig till en arbetsplats som ger dig glädje, stimulans och möjlighet att växa inom det område du brinner för. Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som satsar på din framtid och jobbar i teknikens framkant med ett högt säkerhetstänk. Med säkerhetsprövade medarbetare och säkerhetsklassade lokaler- och datahallar garanterar vi trygghet och integritet för våra kunder.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder**
 🥪 En himmelsk fredagsfrukost med kollegorna
   

  

 🌍 Hybrid arbetsplats
   

  

 💑 Roligt på jobbet - allt från träning till resor och spelkvällar
   

  

 🍏 Ett välfyllt lager av frukt, nötter, gudomligt kaffe från en Kunglig Hovleverantör om så önskas.
   

  

 🍰 Fredagsfika tillsammans
   

  

 🏡 Ett stenkast till både shopping på Mall of Scandinavia och natursköna Brunnsviken som är perfekt för löpning och lunchpromenader
   

  

 ✔ Goda och trygga anställningsvillkor.
   

  

 🙌 Frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete, vi tror på "Work life balance"
   

  

 👩🏽‍🤝‍🧑🏼 Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig 💛
   

  

 🚗 Goda parkeringsmöjligheter
   

  

 🏌️‍♂️ Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

 Här kan du även läsa mer om våra värderingar
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan i formuläret nedan.**
**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?**
 Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:
   

  

 Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total
   

  

 Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se
   

  

 Tel: 070 -729 19 82

title: Systemarkitekt
description:
*Brinner du för att driva förändring av komplexa IT-lösningar med hjälp av nya tekniker och agila arbetssätt? Här på Fondliv är vi mitt i en spännande omvandling där vi fokuserar på att modernisera vårt IT-landskap och leverera mervärde till våra kunder på ett snabbare sätt än någonsin tidigare. Vi utforskar nya tekniker och lösningar för att bygga en mer effektiv IT-miljö med hjälp av moderna och agila arbetssätt. Vi förstärker nu vårt team med ytterligare en kompetent medarbetare. Vill du vara med och forma framtiden med oss? Läs då vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Systemarkitekt (Tågarkitekt) i vårt arkitekturteam kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare i vår pågående digitala transformation inom liv- och pensionsområdet. Tillsammans med dina kollegor kommer du att arbeta med övergripande arkitektur, modernisering och avveckling av system samt digitalisering och automatisering för att möjliggöra vår digitala förflyttning. Du rapporterar direkt till Chef Arkitektur & Projektledning och samarbetar nära arkitekter både inom Fondliv och övriga Länsförsäkringar, samt våra utvecklingsteam och leverantörer.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**
* Planera och utveckla tågets Architectural Runway, samt att ta fram och kommunicera en arkitekturell vision för tåget.
* Säkerställa att arkitekturella enablers finns i tågets backlogg.
* Bidra och delta i planering och prioritering av arbetet med fokus på att klargöra systemsambanden på de nivåer som krävs för att lösningarna kan utvecklas i önskad riktning.
* Delta i tågcermonier som t.ex. PI-planering, demos och I&A.
* Säkerställa att föreslagna tekniska lösningar håller ihop och koordineras inom tåget och att ny funktionalitet stödjer den arkitekturella visionen.
* Tillsammans med teamen säkerställa att systemen uppfyller kvalitetsbehov och coacha utvecklare för ökad förståelse.
* Aktivt bidra under Continuous Exploration-fasen, som en del av Continuous Delivery Pipeline, med tyngd på området enablers.
* Säkerställa lämpligheten i framtagna lösningar med relevanta intressenter utanför det egna tåget.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt. Som person är du ansvarstagande, tar ägandeskap och har förmågan att begripliggöra tekniska lösningar för personer utan teknisk kompetens. Du kan strukturera upp angreppssätt för att lösa problem, definiera vägen framåt både från ett helhetsperspektiv och för specifika områden och får energi av att driva förflyttningen. Vidare är du en god kommunikatör som är lyhörd och samarbetar bra med andra människor. Precis som vi andra inom arkitekturteamet är du intresserad av och vill jobba kunddrivet enligt moderna metoder och agila arbetssätt. Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har kompetens inom ett eller flera av följande områden:**
* Lösningsarkitektur med fokus på olika typer av mjukvara.
* Molnlösningar och SaaS-tjänster och en gradvis förflyttning från On-Prem till Cloud.
* Integrationsarkitektur och API-lösningar.
* Vara med och forma den agila arkitekturförmågan och förflyttning mot DevOps.
* Informationsförsörjning och masterdata i ett komplext IT-landskap.
* Infrastruktur- och IT-säkerhetsarkitektur.


 Kompetens från att tidigare ha arbetat med pensionsrelaterade produktsystem är meriterande.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi välkomnar dig till gruppen Arkitektur och projektledning, som samlar de roller på IT-Liv som arbetar på bredden över hela Liv-domänen. Gruppen består idag av 12 personer, anställda och konsulter. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Fondliv är liv- och pensionsförsäkringsbolaget inom Länsförsäkringar och är en av Sveriges största aktörer på pensionsmarknaden. Vi är ett kundägt bolag med stort samhällsengagemang och fokus på hållbarhet. På Fondliv planerar vi stora tekniska förflyttningar de närmsta åren och det finns gott om spännande utmaningar och stora möjligheter att utvecklas.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-31**

title: Senior Solutions Consultant - Supply Chain
description:
At Anaplan, we are a team of innovators who are focused on optimizing business decision-making through our leading scenario planning and analysis platform so our customers can outpace their competition and the market.
   

  

 What unites Anaplanners across teams and geographies is our collective commitment to our customers’ success and to our Winning Culture.
   

  

 Our customers rank among the who’s who in the Fortune 50. Coca-Cola, LinkedIn, Adobe, LVMH and Bayer are just a few of the 2,400+ global companies that rely on our best-in-class platform.
   

  

 Our Winning Culture is the engine that drives our teams of innovators. We champion diversity of thought and ideas, we behave like leaders regardless of title, we are committed to achieving ambitious goals and we have fun celebrating our wins.
   

  

 Supported by operating principles of being strategy-led, values-based and disciplined in execution, you’ll be inspired, connected, developed and rewarded here. Everything that makes you unique is welcome; join us and be your best self!
   

  

 We are seeking a dynamic
 **Presales** 
**Supply Chain Solutions Consultant** 
 with experience in the manufacturing or retail sectors. In this role, you will leverage Anaplan's platform to design and present tailored supply chain solutions, addressing the unique challenges of major enterprise customers.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Client Engagement: Collaborate with large enterprise prospects to identify inefficiencies in their supply chain processes. Demonstrate how Anaplan's solutions can effectively address these challenges, driving significant improvements.
* Solution Development: Design and deliver customized, domain-specific demonstrations and proof-of-concept models that directly address client pain points.
* Technical Expertise: Utilize your deep understanding of supply chain processes to showcase the capabilities of Anaplan's platform, ensuring alignment with client needs and business objectives.
* Collaboration: Work closely with sales, product development, and implementation teams to ensure seamless integration of proposed solutions into clients' operations.
* Thought Leadership: Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices to provide innovative solutions and maintain a competitive edge in the market.


**Your Qualifications**
* Experience: Pre-sales experience in supply chain management within the manufacturing or retail industries. Prior experience with enterprise planning management (EPM) or business process management (BPM) solutions is advantageous.
* Technical Proficiency: Strong understanding of supply chain processes, including demand planning, supply planning, inventory management, and production planning. Experience with multi-dimensional modeling, business intelligence, or analytics is a plus.
* Communication Skills: Exceptional presentation and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Problem-Solving Ability: Proven track record of analyzing complex client problems and developing tailored solutions that drive business value.
* Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, quickly learn new technologies, and adapt to changing client needs.
* Travel Requirement: Willingness and ability to travel approximately 50% of the time within the EMEA region to engage with clients and support sales activities.


**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion** 

**and Belonging**
 Build your career in a place that thrives on diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. We believe in a hiring and working environment where all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day!
   

  

 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive equitable benefits and all privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**Fraud Recruitment Disclaimer** 
  

  

 It has come to our attention that fraudulent and fictitious job opportunities are being circulated on the Internet. Prospective candidates are being contacted by certain individuals, mainly through telephone calls, emails and correspondence, claiming they are representatives of Anaplan. The main purpose of these correspondences and announcements is to obtain privileged information from individuals.
   

  

 Anaplan does not:
   

  

* Extend offers to candidates without an extensive interview process with a member of our recruitment team and a hiring manager via video or in person.
* Send job offers via email. All offers are first extended verbally by a member of our internal recruitment team whenever possible, and then followed up via written communication.


 All emails from Anaplan would come from an @anaplan.com email address. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Anaplan, please send an email to people@anaplan.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.

title: Digital Workplace Transformation Leader - Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
**Role** 
 – Industry Principal /Digital Workplace Transformation Leader
   

  

**Skill** 
 - Digital Workplace Transformation
   

  

**Location** 
 – Sweden
   

  

**Compensation** 
 – Competitive (including bonus)
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.


**Required - Mandatory:**
* Experience in IT .
* A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
* Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
* Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains –


 Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).
   

  

**Personal**
 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
   

  

* Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
* Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.


**Why Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

title: ICT Enterprise Architect
description:
**Grow with us**
**About this opportunity:**
 Service Area Networks main accountabilities are Product Management and Service Delivery for product areas Network Deployment (ND) and Customer Support (CS). We also deliver the global development environments for R&D units across the Ericsson group. SAN is an organization of around 5000 employees based in 34 countries within Business Area Networks.
   

  

 The E2E architecture is implemented to improve our customer experience globally across all Market Areas, based on the strategies within Business Area Networks (BNEW) and Service Area Networks (SAN).
   

  

 Our Network Deployment Project business flow transformation and Intelligent Deployment are key transformation activities within the Ericsson Group. It includes Services, Supply, Finance, Sourcing and Sales activities. The Enterprise Architecture is also prepared for Customer Support and open RAN solutions. It addresses the need of a common data architecture and information model, secur-ing consistency between capabilities, processes, security, IT applications and platform technologies including AI.
   

  

 There are interactions with a broad range of stakeholders, such as Business Areas, Market Areas and Group IT.
   

  

 The position will report directly to Nils Torstensson, Head of SAN Services Supply Chains & Architecture. We have team members in different parts of the globe, and we are used to work remotely.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Develop and implement the Enterprise Architecture for our data driven E2E digitalized business flow for pre-sales, ordering, delivery and customer support
* Analyze strategies and Customer needs. Break it down into defined target architecture
* Translate requirements to cost efficient architectural capabilities
* Secure architecture compliance throughout the complete end-to-end flow
* Communicate, co-operate and consult with each stakeholder group


**The skills you bring:**
* 5-10 years of experience in architectural design of Processes, Information and IT Solutions
* Demonstrated skills of implementing AI use cases and platforms
* Deep understanding of business models, strategies and customer experiences
* Knowledge of Ericsson Target Architecture Master Plan (TAMP) and its applications
* Ability to translate business requirements into architectural solutions
* Leadership skills to create results in diverse global teams
* Proven track record generating trust from customers and Market Areas


**Last date to apply: 4th June 2025**
**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Versha Sharma
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 767220

title: Technical Support Manager (Nordics & APAC)
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a
 **Technical Support Manager,** 
 you will guide, be the voice and represent the interests of the Technical Support team, a team of seven talented members, for our direct markets (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Australia, China) to ensure they provide best-in-class support to our users and prescribers.
   

  

 Together with EUROW Customer Service & Support Manager, you will develop and implement strategic plans and objectives to raise overall business value. While ensuring a great collaboration globally in our direct markets, you will build great relationships inside and outside the organization, including sales and logistics.
   

  

 If you are an inspiring leader and a proactive problem solver, who is passionate about coaching teams and improving processes to deliver best in class customer experiences, this is a great opportunity for you!
   

  

**Please note:** 
 This is an
 **onsite** 
 role in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Lead, Coach & Develop Your Team
* Oversee day-to-day case management, ensuring timely and accurate solutions.
* Ensure the team has sufficient technical knowledge for current and new products and planning ongoing training for the team.
* Conduct 1:1 meetings, team meetings, performance appraisals and salary reviews with team members.
* Nurture great collaborative culture in the team, promoting open and honest communication.
* Optimize Processes & Solve Problems
* Maintain and optimize procedures, processes, and systems to support the market globally.
* Ensure Technical Support global scalability and availability as we grow our markets.
* Build Relationships & Collaborate
* Act as escalation point for resolving Technical Support related issues.
* Collaborate with direct market regional managers to grow their markets.
* Work alongside Sales Operations to implement strategic plans.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone that has:
   

  

* At least 1 year of experience in technical support and/or customer service is required.
* Previous team and/or operational leadership experience in tech support and/or customer service experience is high valued.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English are required. Proficiency in Norwegian or Swedish is a plus!
* Familiarity with Microsoft 365 tools.
* Experience with CRM systems is required (Salesforce, Dynamics 365 is a bonus).


**What is next?**
 Please submit your resume and/or LinkedIn profile
 **(in English)** 
 through our career website. We look forward to your application!
   

  

**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Head of Operations
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European-owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 At the outset of our journey, we're not just building software; we're laying the groundwork for our technology solutions and how we’ll operate as an engineering team. As we expand, the organisation of our teams and the specialisation into product areas hinge on these formative decisions. Coming on board now means you're not just coding - you're contributing directly to how we set ourselves up for success, how we tackle challenges, and how we define our engineering culture. This isn’t just a job; it's a chance to leave an indelible mark on our technology, teams, culture, and ethos.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Head of Operations with technical expertise to lead and optimise our global operations. As a critical member of our leadership, you will direct operations teams across multiple data centres and regions, ensuring the highest standards of service reliability, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. You and your team will play a key role in establishing and refining operations while driving continuous improvement initiatives. Your role will be essential in managing large-scale incident response and problem resolution, building and leading technical support teams across multiple tiers, and collaborating with engineering teams to enhance products based on operational insights, while also creating our standard operating procedures and business continuity.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Direct global operations teams across multiple data centres and regions.
* Establish and optimize support infrastructure, SLAs, and escalation protocols.
* Develop metrics and KPIs to measure operational performance and customer satisfaction.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service reliability and efficiency.
* Manage large-scale incident response and problem resolution processes.
* Build and lead technical support teams across multiple tiers.
* Collaborate with engineering on product improvements based on operational insights.
* Establish standardized operating procedures and playbooks.
* Lead crisis management during major service disruptions.


**Skills We Value**
* 10+ years of experience in technical operations management, preferably in cloud services.
* Proven leadership experience managing large, distributed technical teams.
* Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure, virtualization, and networking.
* Track record implementing automation and operational efficiency improvements.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with incident management and problem resolution at scale.
* Knowledge of compliance requirements for cloud services.
* MBA or technical degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Experience with data analytics and performance measurement systems.


 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Senior Enterprise Systems Specialist
description:
We’re a global team of over 400 people, working together to push the boundaries of open-source technology and multi-cloud solutions. Our vision is to become the trusted Data & AI Platform for everyone, leveraging the most popular open-source technologies like Apache Kafka®, Aiven for PostgreSQL®, Aiven for Clickhouse®, and Aiven for OpenSearch®. to help companies accelerate time-to-market, drive efficiency, and build innovative solutions across any cloud. Right now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Enterprise Systems Specialist** 
 to join our team who shares our passion for forward-thinking and innovative approaches.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 So, how do we become the trusted open source data platform for everyone? By listening closely to our customers and taking action to ensure they achieve their business goals. You see, the software we create is merely a means of delivering value. Our thinking is customer-first. That’s why our customers are at the front and center of all we do. And in the spirit of sideways thinking, we’re by their side as well. Actively helping them solve their challenges. Collaborating. Sharing. And innovating. In other words, it really isn’t just about who we are. It’s about who our customers are – and where they want to be.
   

  

**Our Crabby Principles**
 Aiveners use the V2MOM framework to set and align on business goals. In order to achieve those business goals we live by our ‘Crabby Principles’ which unite us in our ways of working, globally.
   

  

 These principles are embedded in our business processes and support us in collaborating and role modelling positive and productive behaviours in our daily work, something you will have the opportunity to demonstrate throughout your interview journey with us.
   

  

**The Role:**
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Enterprise Systems Specialist to join our Enterprise Systems and IT team. This role will be pivotal in managing and optimizing our business systems that integrate with each other. You will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation, maintenance, and enhancement of these systems to support our financial operations.
   

  

 The Senior Enterprise Systems Specialist will serve as a primary point of contact for NetSuite administration, configuration, and user support, focusing specifically on financial modules and related integrations. They will be part of a team that manages other core enterprise systems in addition to our financial ones. This role will be crucial in leveraging NetSuite capabilities and other SaaS applications to solve critical business challenges.
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* Manage and optimize NetSuite financial modules: Serve as the primary administrator, configuring, maintaining, and enhancing NetSuite financial functionalities (General Ledger, A/R, A/P, Fixed Assets, etc.) to meet evolving business needs and ensure data accuracy. Also, act as a trusted advisor to project teams, providing in-depth application expertise and ensuring smooth transitions during system upgrades and implementations, specifically for financial modules.
* Provide expert technical support and troubleshooting: Resolve technical issues related to NetSuite financial modules, including integrations and customizations, and provide ongoing end-user training and support.
* Collaborate on system enhancements and integrations: Work with cross-functional teams (Finance, People, Sales) to gather requirements, implement system enhancements, and manage integrations with other enterprise data systems focusing on financial data flow.
* Analyze and improve financial processes: Identify opportunities for process improvements within NetSuite and other related applications, streamline operations, and ensure optimal system performance and ROI.
* Mentor and support team members: Provide guidance and support to your peers, review deliverables, and contribute to the professional development of the team.


**What we're looking for:**
* Has a current NetSuite Certified Administrator certification.
* Experience with NetSuite financial modules such as General Ledger, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, and Fixed Assets. Knowledge of multi-currency is a plus.
* At least 5 years ERP experience—implementations and upgrades.
* 3+ years NetSuite OneWorld experience.
* Experience with other SaaS applications such as Zip (procurement orchestration), HiBob (HRIS), Abacum (financial planning & analysis) and Salesforce (CRM) is a plus.


**Knowledge, Skills And Abilities**
* Solid understanding of accounting principles, with the ability to apply accounting knowledge to NetSuite configurations and troubleshooting.
* Strong technical proficiency in NetSuite administration, including customizations, workflows, and saved searches, specifically for financial modules. Proficiency of SuiteApprovals and SuiteScript a plus.
* Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve system issues, both within the standard NetSuite functionality and with advanced troubleshooting methods.
* Knowledge of several different functional areas of NetSuite such as Finance, Procurement, HR Management, CRM, etc.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think analytically to diagnose and resolve complex system-related issues.
* Proven drive for personal and professional growth by researching and evaluating new finance technologies to ensure we're using the best tools available. A constantly-learning mindset and approach is required.
* Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented with a commitment to maintaining data accuracy and system integrity.
* Self-motivated, able to work alone and in teams, articulate, and able to inspire confidence in audiences.
* Process analysis, redesign, and documentation experience.


 Don’t worry if your experience doesn’t line up perfectly – we still encourage you to apply! We believe in investing in our crabs’ professional growth.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 If you ask us what’s the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it’s the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.
   

  

**We invest in you**
* Participate in Aiven’s equity plan.
* With Aiven locations spanning the globe, we want all of our crabs to find the right balance with our hybrid work policy.
* Get the equipment you need to set yourself up for success.
* Step up your career game with real employer support (use one of our learning platforms, annual learning budget, and more).
* Get holistic wellbeing support through our global Employee Assistance Program.


**Make a difference at Aiven**
* Contribute to open source projects that you find meaningful outside of work - and get paid for it! Our Plankton program recognizes extra work to the open source ecosystem for developers and non-developers alike.
* Use up to 5 days per year to volunteer for a good cause of your choice.
* Join one of our team member resource groups - empower yourself and others in missions that resonate with you.


**What else?**
 Need insurance? We’ve got you covered - benefit from our travel insurance.
   

  

**Amazing! What’s next?**
 Once applying you should hear from our Talent Experience team within 5 days regarding the status of your application. If you are selected to move forward you can generally expect 4 stages with us
   

  

* 30-45 minute call with one of our Talent Partners
* 45 minute Depth of Expertise Interview with the hiring manager
* Skills interview and or presentation for 1 hour with the wider team
* Company values interview for 1 hour


**How To Recognise And Avoid Employment Scams**
 There has been a rise in fake job postings used by scammers to get personal information. Please familiarise yourself with the red flags of a potential scam.
   

  

 Here at Aiven, all of our emails relating to recruitment come from an @aiven.io, @greenhouse.io or @eu.greenhouse.io domain and all of our interviews are conducted over video call or in person, our interviews will never occur over text or chat. If you’re unsure of the legitimacy of a job opportunity/offer pertaining to Aiven, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes. Aiven complies with applicable local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.
   

  

 At Aiven we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We make all reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities or who otherwise need support to thrive in the workplace. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. There is an option to request a discussion in the application process but if you have any questions before applying please write to us at recruitment@aiven.io.

title: Erfaren IT-infrastrukturspecialist till globalt företag
description:
Till vår kund i centrala Stockholm söker vi en erfaren och engagerad IT-infrastrukturspecialist som vill arbeta med drift och förvaltning av en stabil och affärskritisk IT-miljö tillsammans med ett sammansvetsat infrastrukturteam. Här får du en nyckelroll där du arbetar brett med serverhantering, nätverk och säkerhet i en miljö som ständigt utvecklas.
 



  





 Tjänsten börjar som ett konsultuppdrag via Centric, och efter sex månader kommer anställningen att övergå direkt till kunden. Detta är en utmärkt möjlighet för dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra med din expertis i en internationell organisation med långsiktigt fokus på tillförlitlig IT-infrastruktur.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Hantering av virtuella maskiner (implementering, förvaltning och avveckling) i VMware- och Nutanix-miljö
* Hantering av Windows servermiljön (onprem)
* Felsökning och drift av Cisco LAN och trådlösa nätverk
* Leda och delta i projekt
* Hantering av brandväggsregler och ständigt förbättra säkerheten i våra miljöer
* Självständigt och tillsammans med andra lokala och globala team vara drivande i att utveckla befintlig miljö och implementera nya system
* Incidenthantering
* Stötta verksamheten vid implementering och uppgradering av verksamhetssystem



  





**Din Profil Och KvalifikationerKrav** 



* Minst 4-6 års yrkeserfarenhet inom relevanta områden
* Relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning och CCNA eller motsvarande kunskap
* Erfarenhet av drift och underhåll av nätverk, Windows serverar, Active Directory, GPO och VMware
* Scripting kunskaper
* Flytande i tal och skrift i både svenska och engelska



  





*Det är meriterande om du har gått kurser eller innehar certifikat från VMware, Nutanix, Microsoft, Cisco och ITIL.* 




  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas.
