title: IT-Specialist - Observability
description:
Would you like to be a part of shaping the future of observability and play a key role in the development of stable, future-proof monitoring solutions? We are looking for a driven IT Specialist in Observability who wants to work with exciting technologies and contribute to optimizing our platforms. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of an engaged team where you can take responsibility and drive innovation. Are you ready to take your expertise to the next level and shape technical guidelines for our cloud solutions? Then this could be the role for you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an IT Specialist in Observability, you will work on implementing, optimizing, and further developing our observability platforms. Together with the team, you will take full responsibility for the operation, support, and improvement of our monitoring systems, playing a key role in establishing guidelines and processes for observability in our cloud solutions. You will become an expert and a key person in the organization, spreading knowledge and best practices in the field. You will be part of a specialist team where you’ll have the opportunity to influence our technical direction and work with modern tools and technologies.
   

  

**You Will Also Work With**
* System monitoring, log management, and performance optimization
* Implementing and optimizing observability solutions
* Incident handling and system problem analysis
* Developing guidelines and processes for observability
* Documenting observability structures and workflows


 You will be part of our Observability team, which belongs to our Operations Platforms Area within Tech. Alongside competent and engaged colleagues, you will work to find new and innovative solutions to improve our workflows. You will also collaborate closely with developers, operations technicians, and other stakeholders to ensure robust and effective systems.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
 To succeed in this role, you should be analytical, detail-oriented, and have a problem-solving mindset. You thrive in a role where you can collaborate with different teams and share your knowledge with others. We are looking for someone passionate about observability and with a strong interest in technology. To succeed in the role, we expect you to be service-oriented, flexible, and eager to learn a lot. You should also have solid knowledge of system monitoring, log management, and performance optimization.
   

  

**We Would Prefer If You Have**
* Previous experience working with observability platforms
* Experience working with modern infrastructure, preferably cloud platforms like Google Cloud
* A strong understanding of DevOps environments and CI/CD processes
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, spoken and written


 As a person, we believe you are driven to develop and improve, have strong communication skills, and the ability to build and maintain relationships within the organization. To succeed in this role, you are self-motivated with a strong ability to effectively drive your work forward, while also being a good team player. You are relationship-driven and good at planning and organizing your work. It is an advantage if you have experience with containerization using Docker and Kubernetes, as well as working with infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform and Ansible.
   

  

**Application**
 Submit your application by clicking the "Apply Now" button below the job posting. Please send your application as soon as possible, as the selection process is ongoing, but no later than 8/6. We do not accept applications via email due to GDPR. Feel free to contact Marie Grenander, Engineering Manager, at marie.grenander@avanza.se if you have any questions about the position.
   

  

 Welcome with your application!
   

  

*Offers from recruitment agencies/advertisers are discouraged.*
 Avanza är Sveriges ledande internetbank för sparande och placeringar. Vi drivs av att förändra branschen genom att utmana de stora bankerna och försäkringsbolagen på den svenska sparmarknaden. Vi vill vara tjänsten som förenklar och förbättrar spararnas ekonomi, oavsett om man älskar aktier eller bara vill ha ett bra sparande. Vår vision är att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. Därför står våra kunders bästa alltid i fokus, precis som det borde vara. Affärsidén är enkel – mer till dig, mindre till banken. En idé som gett oss Sveriges nöjdaste sparare 15 år i rad.

title: Senior ML Operations Engineer
description:
**Unleash the AI-driven future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**About the role:**
 We’re looking for a skilled
 **Senior ML Operations Engineer** 
 to join Electrolux vibrant Data Experience Organization AI team. You will report to the Head of AI & Data Science and be part of a highly senior cross-functional team with deep experience in building and deploying AI systems. We are part of a data mesh organization applying product thinking and modern tech stacks on our Global Data & AI platform. We support business functions across the entire company and is the key enabler in realizing the company’s Data & AI transformation.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 Your job is to apply modern AIOps thinking and tech to architect, implement and maintain scalable reliable AI systems. As an MLOps engineer you support with DevOps activities related to AI solutions, including model, code and data, to operationalize AI solutions. It includes applying industry standard tools as well as cutting-edge AI & LLMOps observability techniques and an operationalization framework streamlining the process. If you have a curious mindset, love to ideate and implement complex AIOps challenges and easily collaborates, this is your chance to join a brilliant AI team that prioritises hard to solve the most valuable problems of the company!
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Collaborate with Data Scientists and partners to deliver production-grade scalable MVPs
* Design AI/ML operations architectures to deploy reliable and scalable AI systems
* Apply best practices in software engineering to ensure code quality, performance and long-term maintainability
* Provide MLOps support and MLOps solution assurance to deliver timely enhancements, fixes and optimizations of AI products
* Co-own the ML/AIOps architecture backlog, contributing to the roadmap and guide framework and target architecture design decisions
* Enable AI observability in a cross-team collaborative effort
* Enhance an existing framework for streamlined MLOps taking AI from prototype to production
* Develop and enhance an AIOps framework for Agentic systems
* Contribute to the continuous development and way-of-working of the AI team


**Who you are:**
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science (or equivalent)
* 5+ years MLOps or ML platform engineer experience
* Strong coding skills in Python and PySpark including modern Python tooling (e.g. Pydantic, UV, ruff, FastAPI)
* Solid experience of software engineering best practices such as automated testing (Pytest), code reviewing, packaging (Conda, Docker) and software design patterns
* Experience of CI/CD pipelines for ML workloads (in e.g. GitHub Actions)
* Model tracking and lifecycle tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Model Registry, Unity Catalog and Databricks Asset Bundles)
* Experience with DevOps and orchestration (Airflow, Databricks Workflows, Kubernetes, Helm, k9s)
* Working knowledge of MS Azure, especially deploying and managing services such as Azure Foundry, AKS and Container services
* Monitoring (Logging, Azure Monitor, Grafana, API management) and LLMOps experience (e.g. Tracing, Evals and Embedding analytics)
* Good understanding of cloud networking and security fundamentals (VNET configuration, RBAC and Secrets management)
* Understanding distributed data processing such as Spark, BigQuery or Apache Beam
* Solid understanding of Python concurrency including threading, multiprocessing ad async programming (asyncio)
* Experience of agentic frameworks such as AutoGen or LangGraph is a strong plus


**Where you’ll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarter in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 We are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Insurance policy plan
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Gym and massage
* Extensive learning opportunities


**As part of the Electrolux Group, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**

title: Data Engineer (Databricks)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 800 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!
 



  





**Your role** 




 As a Data Engineer with a Databricks focus, you will be building scalable and secure data platforms. You will leverage your expertise in Databricks, Apache Spark, as well as Azure to design, develop, and implement data warehouses, data lakehouses, and AI/ML models that fuel our data-driven operations.
 



  





*In this role you will play a key part in:* 



* Designing and building high-performance data pipelines: Utilize Databricks and Apache Spark to extract, transform, and load data into Azure Data Lake Storage and other Azure services.
* Develop and maintain secure data warehouses and data lakehouses: Implement data models, data quality checks, and governance practices to ensure reliable and accurate data.
* Building and deploying AI/ML models: Integrate Machine Learning into data pipelines, leverage Databricks ML and Azure ML to develop predictive models and drive business insights.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with business analysts, data scientists, and DevOps engineers to ensure successful data platform implementations.



  





**Your profile** 



* Professional experience of working with Data Engineering
* Fluent Swedish skills - you have the ability to communicate in a professional context
* Proven expertise in Databricks, Apache Spark, and data pipeline development and strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and practices.
* Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud platform, including Azure Data Lake Storage, Databricks, and Azure Data Factory.
* Knowledge of SQL and scripting languages like Python and hands-on experience with AI/ML concepts and tools.



  





**What we believe you will enjoy about working here** 



* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We partner with names such as Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Databricks, which can equip you with valuable certifications in the latest technologies in line with your ambitions.



  





**Your Application** 




*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.* 




  





 Welcome to apply!
 



  





**About Capgemini** 




 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
 



  





**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens kund- och handläggarwebbar för Skandias vård- och gruppförsäkringslösningar? Till ett av våra team i Stockholm söker vi nu en senior fullstackutvecklare som kan vara med att bidra till våra kunders nuvarande och framtida behov inom försäkringsområdet. Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens digitala tjänster för våra kunder och handläggare? Sök redan idag och bli en del av Skandia!
   

  

**Att jobba som fullstackutvecklare**
 Som fullstackutvecklare kommer du vara en nyckelspelare i utvecklingen av våra webbsystem, både för våra kund- och handläggningssystem inom Skandias försäkringsområde.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett webbteam som arbetar med allt från kravställning till utveckling, test och implementation. Teamet har ett starkt fokus på samarbete och kunskapsdelning, och vi använder oss aktivt av par- och mobbprogrammering. Här hittar du en trygg och inkluderande miljö där vi delar idéer och hjälper varandra för att nå våra högt ställda mål.
   

  

 Teamet sitter på kontoret i Stockholm och består av; produktägare (PO), scrum master/systemansvarig, mjukvaruarkitekt, fullstackutvecklare och testare. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe metoden och använder oss av ny teknik som .NET 8 och utveckling av microwebbar. Detta innebär att du kommer att få jobba med både nyutveckling och förvaltning. Samarbetet med andra IT-team är centralt för vårt team, och vi strävar efter att alltid sätta kundens behov i fokus.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till vår gruppchef inom IT Risk & Hälsa.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Söker vi dig som trivs med att samarbeta och ser värdet i att nå framgång tillsammans med andra. Du är en nyfiken person med ett stort intresse för att ständigt lära och utvecklas, både individuellt och i grupp. Med din vilja att utforska nya idéer och lösningar bidrar du till en positiv och innovativ atmosfär i teamet.
   

  

 Vi ser att du arbetat några år med systemutveckling inom .NET och C# i backend samt React.js, Javascript och Typescript i frontend. Du har erfarenhet inom enhetstester och GIT likaså REST APIer. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du även kan svenska flytande, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 I vårt team använder vi verktyg som Webpack, Jest, WCF/SOAP samt plattformar som Azure DevOps och Octopus Deploy erfarenhet av dessa är ett plus, men inget krav. Vi har dessutom påbörjat vår resa med GitHub Copilot och ser det som en självklarhet att du vill ligga i framkant inom AI-stödd systemutveckling. Extra meriterande är om du jobbat inom bank-/ försäkringsbranschen sedan tidigare.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval, så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester via Alva Labs, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen kontakta rekryterande chef Kirsti Heilborn på kirsti.heilborn@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework), där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Var 12:e vecka samlas vi i vår inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för två planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av sex tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista är en innovationssprint – en chans att utveckla och förfina våra system.
   

  

 Vill du vara med på vår resa? Välkommen till Skandia IT!

title: Software Architect - Backend
description:
**Position Summary**
 We’re looking for a Software Architect to guide the technical direction of our B2B SaaS platform. You will take on significant responsibility in setting priorities, defining best practices, and ensuring successful software delivery. Our product is unique, demanding a high level of collaboration and advanced problem-solving. You’ll work closely with our exceptionally skilled architect and a senior team of developers to refine and shape robust, scalable solutions. As our R&D department evolves, we're looking for someone who embraces change, adapts quickly to shifting priorities, and brings a forward-thinking mindset
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Technical Direction & Prioritization – Shape the overall architectural vision while ensuring scalability and maintainability. Translate business goals into practical solutions that drive long-term success.
* Architect & Implement – Design and refine robust, cloud-native solutions (AWS, Docker, Kubernetes). Leverage front-end or full-stack insights to ensure seamless user experiences when necessary.
* Operational Coordination – Work closely with the Product team to align development efforts with business objectives. Document architectural decisions to provide clarity and consistency across teams.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration – Partner with DevOps and other technical teams to maintain efficient CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes. Communicate complex technical challenges and solutions in a clear, constructive manner.
* Continuous Improvement – Stay ahead of SaaS, cloud, and CPQ trends, identifying opportunities to enhance platform performance, security, and scalability.


**Skills & Qualifications**
* 10+ years of experience in software development, ideally within complex systems.
* Strong architectural mindset, identifying synergies across products (CPQ, VIZ, CAD) and future solutions.
* Proven track record in architecting and delivering SaaS solutions (CPQ experience is a plus).
* Expertise in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP), containerization (Kubernetes, Docker), and scalable database design (SQL/NoSQL).
* Backend development expertise (Java or similar) with a willingness to engage in front-end when needed.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.


**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Technical interview
* Interview with our CPO
* Reference check


**Why Tacton?**
* 33 days of paid time off – 30 vacation days plus 3 extra to make sure you get the rest you deserve.
* Premium occupational pension – Our pension plan goes beyond ITP1, with higher employer contributions depending on your age and salary level.
* Generous wellness allowance – 5,000 SEK annually to support your health and wellbeing.
* Weekly treats – Fika one week, breakfast the next – because good food brings people together.
* Private healthcare insurance – Skip the waiting lines and get quick access to private medical care, including specialist consultations and treatments.
* Parental leave top-up – We top up your parental leave so you receive up to 90% of your base salary for up to 6 months, helping you focus on your family without financial stress
* A hybrid workspace - 3 days a week at our Stockholm office, to foster direct knowledge sharing and innovation.


 This role is based in Stockholm, where we have invested in creating our unique home right next to Hötorget station.
   

  

 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Azure ML Engineer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Do you want to be part of our in-house Machine Learning team and take part in PostNord’s digital transformation journey? Do you wish to work hands-on across the whole data engineering area? Then you should apply for this position as an ML Engineer!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a part of the IT organization, we support a variety of different PostNord stakeholders in a multitude of areas, such as e.g. HR, mail and logistics. We are already delivering business critical forecasting models that are an important piece of the puzzle of optimizing our operations. Our digital transformation journey started a few years back with migrating BI/DW platforms to Azure. We are now using that platform to train our ML models on our data sets to enable data-driven decision making.
   

  

 Our technology is focused on the Azure stack, and includes Azure MLW, Azure ML, Azure DevOps, Power BI etc.
   

  

 The Machine Learning team’s main responsibility is to develop and operate ML models used by PostNord production units. As an ML engineer, your role is hands-on, focusing on operating and optimizing our ML workloads and model releases.
   

  

 Responsibility includes take models developed by Data scientists and manage the infrastructure and operations around training and deploying those models. Help build production systems to handle updating models, model versioning and serving predictions to end users.
   

  

 You will be responsible for improving our monitoring/alerting systems for our ML workloads.
   

  

 You'll work closely with a team of data scientists to monitor and improve model accuracy, prevent drift, and improve the cloud infrastructure.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 To fit in the ML Engineer role at PostNord you have been working with software development on an advanced level for several years. It is important that you like to remain hands on, able to take a lead role and enjoy working on complex and challenging solutions.
   

  

 You have a structured approach to code management and can help the team develop code according to best practices.
   

  

 As a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state of the art pace in the domain that you work in.
   

  

 We are looking for you who have
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field.
* Communication skills in both written and spoken English
* 5+ years of experience in data engineering, CI/CD, DevOps, or ML Ops (preferably in an Azure environment).
* Expert skills in version controlling, source code management and artifact management.
* Experience with ML Ops workflows and DevOps practices, including model versioning, automated model retraining, and monitoring.
* Experience with Databricks MLops practices
* Familiar with AI/ML concepts and algorithms.
* Implemented ML Ops best practices such as model drift detection and model governance.


 Meritorious experience
   

  

* Experience working in an agile team
* Prio experience working with enterprise grade data platforms
* Deep understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
* Experience with forecasting and knowledge of time series analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
* Experience in defining data models, schemas, and structures for efficient storage and retrieval of data.
* Azure or AWS Certified.
* Communication skills in both written and spoken Swedish.
* Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.
* Experienced in Azure DevOps, ADF, metadata-driven pipelines, Azure Data bricks, ARM templates, and Azure Functions.
* We accept applications from all of EU but would require a remote colleague to be willing to visit on site on a regular basis.


**We Offer You**
* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and health center (Solna).
* Employee benefits through PostNord’s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
* Great occupational pension terms.

 Apply
   

  

 Welcome to submit your application. The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email recruiter Emina Delkic at emina.delkic@postnord.com.

title: ServiceNow Developers - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
*Are you a swedish speaking pro in ServiceNow and passionate about outstanding customer experience?*
 At Tietoevry Tech Services Sweden, we modernize our customers IT landscape to drive efficiency, agility, innovation and to realize their digital ambitions. Our customers are large Nordic organizations operating in various industries as well as in the public sector. Our aim is to become the market leader in the Nordics and the first choice for our customers’ business renewal. ServiceNow is one of the leading Enterprise Service Management platforms and a focus area for Tietoevry in the Nordic market. We are therefore now looking for
 **ServiceNow Developers** 
 to perform creative work with our customers.
   

  

**When Joining Tietoevry Tech Services As a Servicenow Developer**
* You will work in DevOps model to implement/expand ServiceNow modules ITSM, HR, IRM for our customers
* Implement/modify integrations using REST API or Integration Hub
* Explain and present new ideas and solutions to our customers
* Analyze and resolve production issues around implemented solution based on ServiceNow
* Handle code migration from development to test to production instances of ServiceNow
* Support end users with queries around ServiceNow based implemented solution
* Be a part o a global team


**We Offer You**
 You will make your mark in meaningful projects (for example, developing solutions including ITSM and HR modules of ServiceNow integrating with 3rd party tools). We are a global team with Nordic heritage. With us, you will work with diverse team of experts in an inclusive environment. We also offer you flexibility and a good work-life balance. We will also offer ServiceNow trainings and conferences for you to get relevant certifications.
   

  

**We Believe You To Have**
* Certification as a ServiceNow Administrator
* A few years of experience in ServiceNow developer/ support role
* Strong technical knowledge about ServiceNow ITSM, HR and/or IRM module
* Good Knowledge about ServiceNow On-Premise implementation
* Fluent in swedish and english


**It is meritarious if you also:**
* Are a Certified Implementation Specialist
* Prior exposure working with international teams located across Europe.


 As a person, we believe you to be communicative, keen to work in a global environment, collaborative and a problem solver.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Amit Ambre, amit.ambre@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Testautomatiseringsingenjör - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Har du en bred teknisk bakgrund, passion för problemlösning och vill ansluta dig till ett av Nordens största Tech-företag? Vi söker en Test automation specialist som vill bli en del av Tietoevry Tech Services. Tietoevry Tech Services driver företagsomfattande transformationer av kundernas affärsprocesser, applikationer och infrastruktur.
   

  

 Vårt testteam fortsätter att växa och nu söker vi fler specialister inom test och kvalitetssäkring för spännande konsultuppdrag. Har du stort intresse för testautomatisering, gillar konsultrollen och omväxling samt tycker det är kul att vara en del av ett team där vi aktivt delar med oss av kunskaper inom våra kompetensområden? Bli en av oss!
   

  

**När du börjar på Tietoevry Tech Services som testautomatiseringsingengör kommer du:**
* Att arbeta huvudsakligen självständigt men inom ett testteam med att designa och underhålla automatiserade tester, skapa testskript, exekvera och rapportera resultatet.
* Vårt team arbetar med kvalitetssäkring i alla typer av branscher. Vi har bland annat kunder inom finansbranschen, offentlig sektor, detaljhandeln och tillverkningssektorn. Som konsult hos oss kommer du växla mellan att sitta ute hos kund och arbeta i deras interna projekt och att ingå i någon av våra helhetsåtaganden där leveransteamen ofta jobbar inom agila metoder och DevOps med automatiserade testprocesser.
* Uppdragens omfattning varierar och kan vara både nyutvecklingsprojekt och övergångsprojekt. Oavsett ditt uppdrag kommer du alltid att vara en del av Tietoevrys testcommunity, som består av mer än 1000 kvalitetssäkringspersonal över hela världen.


**Vem Vi Söker**
* Du är svensk medborgare och pratar flytande svenska samt engelska
* Du har några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom testautomationsområdet och kunskap av olika testautomatiserings ramverk och testautomatiseringsprocesser
* Kunskap och erfarenheter av testautomatisering inom Agilt och DevOps-miljöer
* Kunskap inom ett eller flera av följande verktyg och områden: Robot Framework, Java/Selenium, UFT, Playwright eller liknande


 Eftersom du kommer att jobba nära våra kunder i konsultuppdrag så tror vi att du är en social, och analytisk person som gillar att arbeta i en roll där tempot är högt och där arbetsuppgifterna snabbt kan förändras. Vi tror också att du har god kommunikationsförmåga, uppskattar att arbeta i team och att du gärna delar med dig av dina kunskaper samtidigt som du också kan arbeta självständigt och fokuserat när så krävs.
   

  

**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Också Har**
* Certifiering (ISTQB Foundation level eller högre/liknande)
* Kunskaper inom Continuous Integration Testing
* Tidigare arbetat inom telecom, finansiella sektorn, säkerhetsbranschen eller offentlig sektor
* Kunskaper i programmeringsspråk, exempelvis Phyton, Java, .NET


**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.
   

  

**Fick vi dig inspirererad?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag.
   

  

 Vid frågor, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, saeid.mojtahedzadeh@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hoppas vi hörs snart!
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
*Tietoevry värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande av alla kön, åldrar, förmågor, etniciteter, inriktningar, övertygelser och bakgrunder.*
 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Backoffice Manager
description:
Sympower is quickly scaling its flexible asset trading and optimization platform in Europe. Our portfolio includes sizeable BESS projects, corporate & industrial demand response programs, and renewable assets, which we optimize across wholesale and ancillary services markets.


Leveraging your experience in asset-backed power trading operations and BRP environments, you will lead and grow our backoffice operations, settlements, and invoicing processes. You will ensure accurate and timely settlement of our growing portfolio across multiple markets while building scalable systems and processes. In this function, you will work closely with traders, risk analysts, and finance teams to support our rapid expansion across Nordic countries, Greece, and other European markets.


In this role you will report into the Finance department with a matrix report to the Head of Trading and Energy Markets.

**What is in it for you**


We are committed to creating an inclusive, values-based culture where everyone feels that they belong and has the opportunity to do meaningful work.


We offer a market competitive compensation package, including but not limited to:

* 30 Days Paid Holiday Leave
* 1 Day Paid Wellness Leave
* 1 Day Paid Birthday Leave
* Paid Maternity and Partner Leave
* Pawternity Leave
* Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
* Remote Office Budget
* Internet Allowance
* Development Plan & Budget
* Stock Appreciation Rights
* 2 Days Paid Volunteer Leave


Learn about all of our benefits on our careers page.

**What you will do**

* **Settlement excellence** – Lead and execute daily/monthly settlement processes for spot, intraday, and balancing markets; reconcile positions across TSOs, power exchanges, and internal systems
* **BRP operations** – Manage all BRP administrative and reconciliation processes; ensure compliance with TSO requirements across multiple countries
* **Invoicing & revenue management** – Drive improvement in setting up automated workflows for customer billing (flexibility services, demand response, grid services); ensure accurate cost/revenue allocation to assets and customers
* **System architecture** – Lead implementation for settlements/invoicing modules in ETRM or in-house tooling; drive automation to reduce manual processes; integrate with accounting platforms
* **Compliance & controls** – Implement settlement controls to prevent errors; ensure REMIT compliance including transaction reporting; coordinate with auditors; monitor counterparty credit exposure
* **Data governance** – Establish master data standards for assets, contracts, and counterparties; manage meter data validation for BESS, C&I and renewables assets; create KPI dashboards
* **Market expertise** – Apply deep knowledge of Nordic/European settlement rules; handle battery-specific challenges (cycling, SoC); manage C&I baseline calculations and performance verification
* **Strategic scaling** – Build processes to support 10x growth; lead market entry projects; standardize operations across regions; contribute to make-or-buy decisions
* **Team building** – Develop Backoffice team; foster collaboration with Trading, Risk, and Finance; manage external service providers; act as escalation point

* Minimum 6 years of relevant experience in power market operations, with at least 2 years in a senior or team lead capacity
* Proven track record in backoffice operations at asset-backed trading companies, merchant utilities, Optimizers, IPPs, or energy trading houses
* Direct experience managing settlements for €20M+ annual trading volumes
* Track record of building or transforming backoffice functions during growth phases
* Deep knowledge of European power market settlements – spot, intraday, ancillary services (FCR, aFRR, mFRR), capacity payments, and imbalance settlement
* BRP expertise – proven experience managing BRP operations, preferably in Nordic markets; understanding of TSO requirements and portfolio management
* Asset-backed trading experience – familiarity with at least one of BESS, renewables, and demand response settlement specifics; understanding of performance verification and availability calculations
* Systems mindset – experience with ETRM systems; ability to identify automation opportunities; skills to work with IT on integrations and data flows
* Regulatory fluency – working knowledge of REMIT reporting, market regulations, and TSO compliance requirements across European markets
* Leadership skills – ability to build and mentor teams; communicate effectively with traders, executives, and external stakeholders; drive process improvements

**Beneficial skills**

* Professional certifications (CFA, CAIA, PRM) advantageous but not required
* Experience with battery degradation impacts on settlement and warranty management
* Prior exposure to Greek power market settlement mechanisms
* Knowledge of C&I demand response program design and baseline methodologies
* Cloud-native tools experience for building modern backoffice infrastructure
* Project management certification or demonstrated experience leading complex implementations

**Location**


Teammates for this position are based in Amsterdam and Stockholm. This role will be asked to work a hybrid arrangement, with approximately 2 days per week in our office.

**Who we are**


Sympower is accelerating the global transition towards ‘net-zero’ by helping to build smarter, cleaner renewable energy systems. Using our proprietary software platform, we help balance the supply and demand of electricity across international energy networks.


We help businesses, grid operators, asset owners and other energy stakeholders around the world reduce their carbon emissions, integrate more distributed renewable energy resources, and generate new revenue streams by participating in demand-side response services.


Learn more about us in this video.


Since 2022, Sympower has been a certified B Corp, which shows the company is meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency across 5 impact areas: governance, workers, community, environment, and customers.

*Sympower is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.*

*Your personal data will be processed in accordance with ou**r* *Privacy Policy**.*

***MESSAGE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: support for filling this position is not required, so proposals for recruitment services will not be reviewed or responded to.***
company_description: Sympower is a cleantech scaleup driven by the mission of shaping an intelligent and green power system via advanced flexibility software solutions that enhance the value of energy assets.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Are you looking to apply your ML and data analytics skills to help solve one of the biggest global challenges? This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to building more sustainable future by joining one of the largest producers of green energy in the Nordics. Apply your analytical mindset to solving complex business challenges while developing valuable business and organizational skills. This is a great chance to grow your professional network and collaborate with experienced teams across tech and business. The position runs through August 2025 until May 2026, with the possibility of extension.  



**About the role**  

To strengthen our ability to grow our business, we seek a Data Analyst who can apply advanced analytics to our data sets and rapidly pinpoint key insights with potential for high impact on key business outcomes.

In this role, you’ll be part of an ambitious Nordic team of eight people, supporting data-driven decision making at Consumer Customer function and collaborating with stakeholders across Consumer Solutions. Preferably, the position would be based in Stockholm, but also Espoo is a possibility. Ideal candidates have solid statistics, data transformations, programming and Machine Learning skills. Experience with visualization tools like PowerBI is a preference, but not a must. No business experience required.  



**Key Responsibilities:**

* Support us with taking our analytics to the next level – develop a structured way of working in hypothesis driven way to rapidly narrow down large questions to few plausible root causes. Support our analyst community with upskilling.
* Provide actionable insights – with a high degree of autonomy apply advanced analytics approaches to extract insights from our vast customer data and help us connect the dots across areas.
* Identify impactful open questions – follow your curiosity and lift open questions, that should be on our agenda, persuade and challenge with data. Transform complicated business problems to data science workflows.
* Drive innovation – explore and share new technologies, methodologies, and machine learning techniques to enhance our analytics capabilities.
  


  

**About you**  


* Master's degree or Ph.D. in a STEM discipline with a strong focus on data science, machine learning, and computer programming.
* Technical skills: i) Proficient in statistics, optimization, and machine learning techniques; ii) Extensive experience in data preparation and transformation; iii) Fluent in Python (especially PySpark) and SQL, and iv) Familiarity with cloud technologies and software engineering practices.
* Critical thinking and creativity skills, being able to challenge status quo based on data and insights.  

Ability to cooperate smoothly with stakeholders across the Nordics is a must, independent of the location.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Experience with PowerBI including knowledge on DAX and M -languages and dimensional modelling techniques is an advantage, but not a requirement.
* No business experience required, MSc and PhD graduates with applicable skills and high motivation are welcome to apply.

  


**We offer you**
At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.  



**Interested?**  

Submit your CV(incl. publication record and Cover Letter) by 15.06.2025 at the latest. We have ongoing selection and we might call for interviews on an ongoing basis. If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact Gergana Gateva at gergana.gateva@fortum.com.  



To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.  

**We are Fortum**  

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
company_description: Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe.

title: Shift Leader Front Office Scandic Rubinen
description:
Västkustens pärla, Sveriges andra största stad, Lilla London. Kärt barn har många namn. Men det är här det händer! Med bästa läget i Göteborg, mitt på Avenyn, ligger Scandic Rubinen. Spännande inredning en innovativ restaurang och förmodligen Göteborgs bästa takbar. Vi är populära av stammisar, inresande och Göteborgarna själva. Service för oss på Scandic Rubinen innebär alltid att vara det självklara valet för våra gäster, med detaljer i fokus, kreativitet och spontanitet. Ett hotell där våra medarbetare trivs och vill fortsätta utmanas och utvecklas i litet som stort. Tillsammans skapar vi stämning och atmosfären som präglar vistelsen för alla våra gäster och kollegor.


**Nu söker vi en Shift Leader till Scandic Rubinen.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Som Shift Leader agerar du värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Under din tid hos oss kan dessa områden variera i takt med att du och affären utvecklas. Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad innebär rollen som Shift Leader Front Office?**



Du som arbetar inom Front Office är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning. Arbetet i Front Office innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet.



I rollen som Shift Leader har du, förutom att vara en del av driften, den övergripande överblicken över gästflödet och ser tillsammans med teamet till att prioritera arbetsuppgifter så att verksamheten flyter så att gästerna blir nöjda. Du leder och fördelar arbetet och hanterar bemanningen under ditt arbetspass. Vid behov får du utbilda nya medarbetare på hotellet och du avlastar också Front Office Manager med vissa administrativa arbetsuppgifter.



Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Din kompetens**



För den här rollen krävs att du har både förmåga och vilja att arbeta med ett driftsnära ledarskap. Du är trygg i ditt ledarskap och har både integritet och säljdriv. För att passa i rollen tror vi också att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster. Du är en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.



Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


**Information om tjänsten:**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med start efter sommaren.


Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.



Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!


Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_addresses:
Scandic Hotels Deutschland GmbH
Gabriele-Tergit-Promenade 19
10963 Berlin
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Bid Manager, Data Driven Care - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.*We are looking for an experienced* *Bid Manager* *to join the Strategic Sales and Business Development team within* *Tietoevry Care’s Data Driven Care* *business unit. Data Driven Care is focused on driving growth in Nordic and selected European markets, and its product portfolio includes Lifecare Data Platform, Lifecare Open Platform and Lifecare Resource Optimization.*
About us
Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.
We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from intensive care to laboratory and social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
As a Bid Manager, you will take the administrative lead in managing complex, international public and private procurement processes. You will coordinate the end-to-end bidding process and contribute directly to winning large-scale contracts that matter.
You’ll work in skilled bid teams alongside sales managers, solution leads, product managers, and other specialists. You will also play a vital role in governing Data Driven Care’s international go-to-market partners in contractual and administrative matters with them and supporting partner reporting, compliance, and steering group activities.
Your Responsibilities* Coordinate and manage the administrative process of tender submissions in international contexts
* Drive tender compliance, documentation, and delivery in collaboration with the full bid team
* Liaise with internal stakeholders including sales, legal, finance, product and delivery organizations
* Act as the key administrative interface for external partners during bidding processes
* Manage partner agreements, contract administration and lifecycle documentation
* Support and facilitate bid and partner governance processes such as reporting, performance follow-ups, and steering group meetings
* Track deadlines, deliverables, and risks associated with ongoing bids and contracts


What We’re Looking For* Proven experience in co-ordinating bids in public procurement processes
* Familiarity with large-scale tenders, preferably in the European public or healthcare sectors
* Excellent organizational and documentation skills with a keen eye for detail
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills – able to collaborate across functions and cultures
* Experience working with contracts, technology and go-to-market partners, and governance frameworks
* Fluent in English (German is a big plus, also other European languages e.g. Dutch or some Nordic language will add value)


Preferred Background* Background in software product or IT consultancy business
* Experience in roles related to public sector procurements, international B2B and B2Public sales and/or partner management
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Law, Project Management, or a related field


What’s in it for you?* A meaningful role where your work has a real societal impact
* An inclusive, innovative, and supportive workplace culture
* Flexible hybrid work opportunities and a healthy work-life balance
* The chance to work with passionate colleagues building technology that matters


Could you be our new colleague?
We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. Our team is international and we work in hybrid way, so the location is flexible within the listed countries.
If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Hanna Hulkko, Head of Strategic Sales and Business Development (hanna.hulkko@tietoevry.com).
Last day of application is June 8th.*We perform background checks on all final candidates.**Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.**About Tietoevry**Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop* *digital futures where* *businesses, societies, and* *humanity thrive.**Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.*
#LI-Hybrid
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. title: Tech-Savvy Business Consultant
description:
S H I F T is a Technology Advisory & Management consultancy with focus on digitalization & business transformation. Our way of working is leveraging a multidisciplinary approach and combining domain expertise within S H I F T to create business value as a means to solve challenges. We believe that embracing diversity unlocks the potential to achieve impactful outcomes for our people, our clients, and society as a whole.

*Your impact:*

We are now looking for Tech-Savvy Business Consultants with unique blend of technical expertise, business acumen, and exceptional communication skills to deliver tailored solutions that address our client needs. You will bridge the gap between technology and business strategy, helping organizations leverage modern technologies to achieve operational efficiency, market competitiveness, and long-term growth.

*What we´re looking for:*

As a candidate you have a degree in business, technology, or a related field, with hands-on experience in consulting, product development or project management. Your are a strategic thinker, a tech enthusiast, and a collaborative partner committed to inspire us and our clients.

In addition to having a team oriented personality, you will also bring your expertise from one or several domains, preferably with hands-on experience in the area of:

*Domain expertise:*

+ Enterprise and business architecture

+ Governance frameworks for IT-deliveries or data management

+ Software architecture, cloud computing, cybersecurity, and data analytics platforms

+ Business models, operational workflows, and market trends

*Personal skills:*

+ Analytical mindset to identify issues, and design innovative technology-driven solutions

+ Ability to convey ideas clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences

+ Stay updated on emerging technologies and strategies

+ Open-minded, eager to learn, and resilient in the face of change

title: CFT Engineer in CoE Integration \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about new technology and making a difference? Join our digital transformation!

SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
**About the role:**As a CFT Engineer You will be a part of a team which supports and maintains integration platform components for SEB globally also work with operations, development, maintenance, and security of the file transfer platform. We work with modern File manage software systems, cloud enabled technologies, modern tools with a sip of mainframe to achieve high productivity. We are 14 people located in Vilnius and Stockholm and working in Agile.
### **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**

* Someone who has good understanding about the various operating systems Unix/Linux/Windows systems
* Integration protocols (eg. FTPS, SFTP, AS2)
* Networking (firewall, routing NAT’ing)
* Experience in API driven automation of enterprise business processes
* Ability to work as a team member
* Service minded and customer oriented
* Self-going, quick learner, motivated, positive and open minded with excellent communication skills
* Willing to share knowledge, help others and accept help
* Strong sense of responsibility and commitment
* Good English language skills

### **What we offer:**

* Curious and always ready to help colleagues
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Challenging, cutting-edge work

**Do you want to be part of SEB?**It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025.06.27. If you have questions about the position, please contact Silvija Meliukste via Silvija.meliukste@seb.se or Anton Hänni via anton.hanni@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.

*Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.* **Learn more about working at SEB** on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
https://sebgroup.com/career
https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Specialistsäljare - Microsoft CSP
description:
Ta chansen och var med på vår tillväxtresa. Hos oss får du arbeta med världsledande technologier från Microsoft i ett framgångsrikt säljteam.



Just nu söker vi inom Ateas affärsområde Software Cloud & Services dig som vill arbeta som Specialistsäljare i vårt Microsoft CSP-team. **Arbetet utgår från kontoret i Växjö alternativt Stockholm/Kista.**



Hos Atea Software Cloud & Services får du möjlighet att växa både professionellt och som människa. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som präglas av medarbetare som brinner för att bygga Sverige med IT, tar personligt ansvar och sätter laget före jaget. Vi kallar oss stolt för landslaget i informationsteknologi.


**Din roll**
------------



Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med försäljning av Ateas och Microsofts erbjudanden. Fokus för arbetet är att utveckla och växa Ateas Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider (CSP) affär med tillhörande tjänster. Du ansvarar här för säljande, affärsstödjande och operativa aktiviteter kopplat till CSP affären.



Kunderna finns både inom privat- och offentlig sektor. Till din hjälp har du ett av IT-branschens starkaste varumärken, ett säljteam med kollegor som sätter laget för jaget samt en vältrimmad leveransorganisation.



Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:


* Utveckla befintliga- och bearbeta nya kunder, med tydliga försäljningsmål och nyckeltal
* Guida våra kunder och bli deras betrodda rådgivare inom området
* Onboarda nya CSP-kunder.
* Stötta Ateas Service Desk i kommersiella ärenden runt CSP-affären
* Vara delaktig i Ateas utveckling av CSP-erbjudandet
* Samarbeta med kollegor i kundteam, med tillverkare och andra affärspartners

**Vem är du?**
--------------



Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper, som också är avgörande för att du ska lyckas i rollen och trivas hos oss. Du är driven i ditt säljarbete och motiveras av att göra affärer och hjälpa våra kunder. Du tar fullt ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och är van att driva dina processer framåt på ett strukturerat och självständigt sätt mot tydliga deadlines. Du är bra på att skapa relationer, ger ett förtroendeingivande intryck och har alltid kundens bästa i fokus. Du söker lösningar på uppkomna problem, gillar utmaningar och fungerar konstruktivt både på egen hand och i grupp.



För att lyckas i rollen tror vi även att du:


* har generell kunskap om- och erfarenhet från arbete i IT-branschen
* tidigare arbetat med Microsoft eller någon av de andra stora mjukvarutillverkarna
* har tidigare erfarenhet av försäljning
* drivs av att guida dina kunder framåt på deras digitaliseringsresa och att försöka förtjäna förtroendet som deras betrodda rådgivare
* gillar förändring då arbetsuppgifterna skiftar i karaktär och omfattning

**Om Atea**
-----------



Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.



På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.


**Kontakt & mer information**
-----------------------------



Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Tomas Persson, Sales Manager, via tomas.persson@atea.se . Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!



Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.



Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

  


**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Senior Software Test Engineer
description:
Senior Software Test Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Location: Stockholm, Sweden


Expected Start date: August 2025


Job Name: Software Test Engineer


We are looking Test Engineer to join their team. This is a fantastic opportunity to work on advanced embedded systems in a dynamic and collaborative environment.  

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**  

• Setting up and managing test benches and environments (HIL/SIL)  

• Writing and executing test plans and test cases  

• Performing system and functional testing, including in-vehicle validation  

• Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure system quality  

• Supporting the development of test frameworks and automation  

  

**Required Skills:**  

• Solid experience with ECU and automotive electronic systems  

• Proficiency in Python and C++  

• Strong understanding of EE architecture, CAN, and UDS protocols  

• Hands-on experience with CANalyzer and CANoe  

• Several years of experience in system and functional testing

  

  

**Nice-to-Have:**  

• Experience with Integration, SIL, and HIL testing  

• Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines  

• Ability to write and execute test cases from embedded system requirements  

• Knowledge of various test frameworks and programming languages


  
Job Overview


* Location : Stockholm, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Python, CAN, HIL/SIL

title: Receptionist Scandic Crown
description:
Scandic Crown ligger ett stenkast från Göteborgs Centralstation med nära till det mesta. Hotellet är nyligen renoverat och har en stor kapacitet för möten och events. Vår gästnöjdhet ligger alltid på en hög nivå vilket vi tror beror på den starka servicekultur som råder här-en servicekultur som möjliggörs av att vi också har nöjda medarbetare. Vi som jobbar på Scandic Crown ser alltid efter varandra och hjälper till när vi kan. Vi är övertygade om att en god stämning bland våra medarbetare leder till enastående hotellupplevelser för våra gäster. Vi tror också på möjligheten att utvecklas för den som vill och därför får alla medarbetare vara med och påverka sin arbetssituation såväl som hotellets utveckling.


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Crown.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid 80%.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

title: Operations Engineer - Orthopaedics
description:
Are you a hands-on problem solver who thrives in dynamic environments? Do you enjoy working across disciplines - support, sales, deployment, cloud, internal tooling - and being the person others rely on when something just needs to get done? We’re looking for a go-to operations engineer to join Sectra Orthopaedics, a self-driven business unit within Sectra's medical division.
  
  

This is a role for a versatile technologist - someone who loves wearing multiple hats, stepping into new challenges daily, and enabling others by keeping things running smoothly behind the scenes.
  
  

**Your Role:** Tech Swiss Army Knife
  
As our operations engineer, you’ll be the team’s technical enabler and all-rounder. You’ll contribute across:
  
  

**Customer support:** Triage technical issues and work with the team on resolving them.
  
**Sales & onboarding:** Assist with demos, PoCs, technical vetting, and helping new customers get started.
  
**Internal support & enablement:** Manage environments, streamline workflows, solve friction points for product, sales, and customer success teams.
  
**Infrastructure troubleshooting:** Networks, scripts, permissions, storage, DICOM configurations - whatever needs solving.
  
  

This is a high-trust, high-ownership role where flexibility, curiosity, and initiative are valued as much as raw technical skill.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
  

**Broad impact:** Work across the stack - internal, external, strategic, tactical.
  
**Customer focus:** Help surgeons and radiologists treat patients better.
  
**Startup energy, global resources:** Small team with wide responsibility, backed by Sectra.
  
**Learning culture:** We hire for attitude and ability - train for skill.
  
**Recognition:** Our support quality consistently earns top marks globally.
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

**Required:**  

Bachelor of Science degree or higher in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering)
  
Strong foundation in IT systems and tech at large
  
**Proven problem-solving mindset:** calm under pressure, analytical by default
  
Fast learner who enjoys jumping into unfamiliar territory
  
Self-sufficient and resourceful - comfortable owning tasks from start to finish
  
Effective communicator and collaborator with technical and non-technical teams
  
Comfortable working in small teams with broad responsibility
  
Fluency in Swedish and English
  
  

**Bonus if you have:**  

Experience with medical IT (DICOM, HL7, PACS, etc.)
  
Hands-on knowledge of Azure/AWS/GCP
  
Scripting skills (PowerShell, Bash, Python, etc.)
  
Familiarity with KQL and Power BI or other analytics tools
  
Previous exposure to customer support, sales engineering, or IT operations
  
Experience with other languages and cultures than those mentioned above
  
  

**Other information:**  

**Location:** Linköping (hybrid: 3 days/week on-site)
  
**Start:** As soon as we find the right person
  
**Recruitment:** Ongoing - apply early to be considered
  
  

Curious? Let’s talk.
  
  

Depending on the role, a mandatory background security screening might be performed as part of the recruitment process at Sectra. Please reach out to the responsible hiring team if you have any questions regarding this.
  
  

Great Place to Work
  
  

Making a difference
  
  

Great colleagues
  
  

Personal development
  
  

Innovation & technology
  
  

Global environment
  
  

Working close to customers
  
  

About the company
  
  

Sectra Orthopaedics builds software to help diagnose and treat orthopaedic disorders—conditions affecting bones, muscles, ligaments, and joints. These are some of the world’s most widespread and costly health issues. Our tools support thousands of surgeons and radiologists globally with visualization, planning, and assessment of orthopaedic procedures using 2D and 3D medical images.
  
  

We're part of Sectra Business Innovation, where new ideas are accelerated, and entrepreneurial units like ours operate with autonomy across product development, marketing, sales, and engineering - while being supported by Sectra’s infrastructure and expertise.
  
  

At our core is a customer-obsessed culture. We’re known for going beyond expectations - not just knowing the right answer, but caring enough to solve the right problem.
  
  

Mattias Bergbom | Contact Person
