title: Global Solutions Architect
description:
DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and motivated technologists who possess a unique balance of technical depth and strong interpersonal skills. You will partner some of the worlds largest Automotive and Manufacturing companies, to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that address customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of AWS services. In collaboration with account managers, you will assist in driving growth across a set of global customers in your defined country. As a trusted customer advocate, the solutions architect will help organizations understand best practices around advanced cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate existing workloads to the cloud. You will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mind share and broad use of AWS within enterprise customers. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is critical to a solutions architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.  

  

Here are some other qualities we are looking for:  

  

Be great fun to work with.  

At AWS, we have a credo of “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. In this role, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge and make a big impact.  

  

Enjoy working with large, global customers. You will have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud solutions for a diverse and challenging set of enterprise customers.  

  

Have a strong understanding of large scale computing solutions. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a systems or support engineer. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions. You will regularly take part in deep-dive education and design exercises to create world-class solutions built on AWS.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

As an AWS Solutions Architect, you will have ownership of the technical relationship with customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability, operational efficiency and best-practice architectures.  

  

Internally, you will be an advocate acting on behalf of the customer to help drive continual improvements to the AWS platform, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features and services. You will also help shape the future of the Solutions Architecture organisation by helping to hire, coach and mentor others.  

  

In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define or invent cloud-native reference architectures with the worldwide AWS Solutions Architect community. You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelise and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).  

  

If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while inspiring the impossible, come build the future with us.  

  

About the team  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.  

  

Diverse Experiences  

Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Why AWS  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  

  

Mentorship and Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
* Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
* Experience in IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries
* Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
* Experience working with AWS technologies from a dev/ops perspective
* Experience with Automotive software development
* Experience in technology/software sales, pre-sales, or consulting
* Excellent command of the Swedish language in both written and verbal forms is highly desired

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
With over 40 years of innovation, Quantum's end-to-end platform is uniquely equipped to orchestrate, protect, and enrich data across its lifecycle, providing enhanced intelligence and actionable insights. Leading organizations in cloud services, entertainment, government, research, education, healthcare, transportation, and enterprise IT trust Quantum to bring their data to life, because data makes life better, safer, and smarter. Quantum is listed on Nasdaq (QMCO). For more information visit www.quantum.com.



As a Regional Sales Manager you are the CEO of your territory – this is your business and Quantum is the umbrella above you. You have a deep understanding of your market and competitors, hunting and winning deals that span across our product portfolio to solve customer problems today but also enable them to be successful for years to come, doing more with Quantum than they can do with any of our competitors combined. Quantum is currently in “build mode” and we need you to join us in reaching new heights to exceed our customers’, partners’ and investors’ expectations as a world class technology company.


**You Are Right for this Role if…**


* You are a highly competitive team player. You like to keep score and you play to win!
* You are a creative problem solver. You love finding solutions to your customers’ biggest pain points or needs, thinking beyond surface-level, and you’re able to identify the root cause of those issues.
* You are selfishly productive. You own your calendar with a maniacal focus on the activities that create, advance, and close sales opportunities.
* You are laser focused on the precious few, high-value activities that move the needle and drive sales results.
* You aren’t afraid, nor do you shy away from, customer objections or the word “no”. You know when to move on from an opportunity and when to probe deeper, bringing in support from your team and leadership as needed.
* You thrive in an environment of ambiguity. You find a way to sell even when you don’t have all the answers.


**In this role, you will…**


* Strategically assess your territory and design a plan to maximize revenue among existing and new business opportunities.
* Build and maintain a robust pipeline that will enable you to exceed your quarterly and annual sales quotas.
* Embrace a customer-first mindset utilizing a consultative, solution-based selling approach when featuring Quantum’s end-to-end portfolio of products and services.
* Create and engage in key customer and partner activities in collaboration with VARS, distributors, Channel & Tech Alliances, Marketing, and Services.
* Cultivate relationships both internally and externally and leverage those relationships to sell as a team.
* Leverage regional and senior leadership to help create, advance, and close deals.
* Research and thoroughly understand Quantum’s competitive landscape.
* Achieve and exceed your quota on a quarterly and annual basis.
* Own all aspects of your Territory.


**Required Skills and/or Experience:**


* 8+ years of outside sales with a focus on new logo acquisition or business development; consistently delivering $5M+ annual revenue.
* A minimum of 5 years’ experience selling complex workflows and solutions in a technology field.
* Avid hunter with proven prospecting skills, consistently opening doors to new customers and navigating seamlessly between the boardroom and the data center while passionately positioning the advantages of Quantum’s end-to-end portfolio of solutions.
* A consultative/solutions selling approach is a must.
* A high degree of honesty, integrity, and sound judgment is required.
* Demonstrated knowledge of negotiation tactics and persuasive sales techniques.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, as well as presentation skills.
* Exceptional organization, time management, prioritization, and multi-tasking skills.
* Creative problem-solving capabilities.
* Team oriented and showcases a positive “can-do” attitude with the ability to motivate and inspire others.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent market aligned experience required.


**Why Should You Join Quantum?**



At Quantum, we understand how to help you capture, manage, and store your video and data – to realize its infinite possibilities. We leverage decades of expertise in storage technology to deliver bold, innovative solutions to forward-thinking organizations. Our technology and services are uniquely designed for video and large data sets – applications that will make up an estimated 80% of all data by 2025. We provide end-to-end solutions built for every stage of data’s lifecycle – offering ultra-fast performance, real time collaboration and analysis, and low-cost archiving – on-premise or in the cloud. We are a company committed to helping to create, innovate, and protect, so together we can make the world a happier, safer, and smarter place.

title: Sales Executive
description:
Join Nordcloud and be part of the European cloud revolution. We supercharge our customers to innovate in hyperscaler cloud, enabling seamless migration, advanced security, and data-driven success. This role focuses on winning new clients in the Enterprise and Corporate business sectors and develop some of our current customers in parallel. As a trusted advisor, you will develop strong relationships with C-level executives and  

stakeholders, ensuring Nordcloud becomes their go-to partner for cloud services.


**Currently, we are looking for a Sales Executive to join our team in Sweden.**


**Your** **daily responsibilities:**

  

* Drive new logo acquisition for Nordcloud Sweden in the Malmo region
* Develop current customers with focus on growing revenue parallel with ensuring customer satisfaction
* Develop and execute a winning sales strategy within your territory
* Build and nurture relationships with C-level and senior executives
* Apply a solution-based sales approach to address complex customer challenges
* Collaborate closely with our partners, including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud
* Maximize Nordcloud's value proposition across infrastructure, applications, managed services, and consulting portfolios


* Occasional travelling may be an option, depending on the assignment and your preferences

  

**Your key skills:**

  

* 4+ years of sales experience in IT consulting and technology
* Proven track record in winning and growing new logos in IT consultancy and services
* Existing network of stakeholders in the industry, including clients and partners
* Expertise in solution selling and crafting tailored value propositions
* Proficiency in handling enterprise RFP processes
* Experience driving sales within enterprise and mid-sized corporations
* Fluent in Swedish and English


We encourage you to **apply**, even if you don't meet all of the requirements. We value your growth potential and enthusiasm!


**What we offer:**

  

* Individual **training budget** and **exam fees** for certifications
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working model
* Laptop and equipment of your choice
* **Local package** such as six weeks of vacation, a pension package, private health care through EuroAccident, wellness benefits (Friskvårdsbidrag), and you can also pick more benefits from benify.se
* We are part of the collective bargaining agreement (Almegas Kollektivavtal - Tech Sverige)


Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy (https://nordcloud.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/) before applying. **All applicants must have the right to work in Sweden.**


**About Nordcloud**


Nordcloud is a European leader in cloud implementation, application development, managed services and training. It's a recognised cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record helping organisations leverage public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings and sustainable value.
  

  

Nordcloud is triple-certified across Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform – with 10 European hubs, over 1,300 employees and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects for companies ranging from midsize to large corporates.  

  

Our clients benefit from multi-cloud expertise that guides best practices, preempts pitfalls, provides essential technical support and steers teams through cultural change. From strategy planning to application management, we take our customers through the whole cloud journey to drive real business outcomes from cloud technology.  

  

Learn more at www.nordcloud.com (http://www.nordcloud.com)


*Nordcloud values diversity and is dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all candidates and employees.*

title: Associate Support Specialist
job_function: Customer Service, Information Technology, and Public Relations
description:
**Job Description**
**Associate Support Specialist**
**LOCATION: STOCKHOLM, SWEDEN**
**FULL-TIME, PERMANENT**
**HYBRID – 3 DAYS IN THE OFFICE**
***Please submit your resume in English!***
 Notified is growing and we are hiring an Associate Support Specialist for the Client Service Delivery team in Stockholm.
   

  

 The Associate Support Specialist is responsible for database administration, account creation, and customer service within the Public Relations line of business. Your role will be to ensure customer service delivery in an accurate and timely manner while upholding security protocols.
   

  

 You will serve as a subject matter expert for Notified Public Relations Cloud products, providing day-to-day client advice and support. You will also promote the organization’s capabilities to clients and identify sales opportunities to be forwarded to the account managers in the Sales Department resulting in contract extensions or additional business within the account(s).
   

  

**Your Task Would Include**
* providing day-to-day client advice, working to maintain strong client relationships
* communicating clearly with clients via phone, email, and chat
* responding to basic client support inquiries, ensuring they are handled in order of priority
* participating in analysis and resolution of unresolved support issues, escalating more complex issues to senior colleagues
* assisting in solving problems for clients, ensuring that SLAs and KPIs are met
* performing administrative duties including account and user maintenance outcomes using good interpersonal skills and organizational skills
* collaborating with teammates to work occasional overtime during high volume periods of other Notified service offerings


**What will you bring?**
* Excellent Swedish & English speaking and writing skills
* Minimum of 1 year of experience in a client-facing position
* Previous newswire experience is preferred
* Customer service experience in a fast-paced environment
* Experience in support of complex products will be considered an advantage.
* Excellent multi-tasking skills
* Exceptional time-management skills, ability to prioritize assignments and meet deadlines
* Projects self-confidence, enthusiasm, and a positive, can-do attitude
* Tech savvy mindset and ability to learn new programs/software quickly


**Why Notified…**
 We place a lot of value in giving our clients the solutions and support they need to operate efficiently and successfully. This same desire we use to set our customers up for success applies to our employees as well. Notified committed to helping our employees and their families maintain a healthy work/life balance, to build a financially secure future. Self-development and learning are key with all our global employees having access to our internal learning and development university DevelopU for career and skills enhancement.
   

  

**What Do We Offer**
* A diverse international work environment - global collaboration with team members in 17 countries!
* Comprehensive health benefits and wellness programs.
* Flexible work arrangements. This role will be based out of our Stockholm office, located at Vasagatan 28. Our expectation at this time is that you would work from the office on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday with flexibility to work from home on Monday and Friday.
* Regular learning sessions, team-building events, and activities.
* Annual social events, including Summer and Christmas parties.
* A culture that celebrates innovation and creativity.
* Access to our virtual university, offering over 8,000 online courses.
* Quarterly Recognition Awards.
* A rewarding Referral Bonus Scheme.


**About NOTIFIED!**
 We believe everyone has a story to tell and we’re passionate about helping people and brands amplify their stories across the globe. We are proud to be the number one provider of enterprise webcasting and investor relations content distribution, as well as a global leader in press release distribution. Our clients have used Notified to monitor over 2 billion social media conversations every year! Our products are built so storytellers can do their best work. But we’re not just a platform—personalized, caring service is how we operate. We add a personal touch to everything we do. We strive to deliver wisdom and insight by helping our clients reach global and targeted audiences, measure outcomes, and fulfill their commitments.
   

  

**Join the Best In Class!**
 “Best Press Release Distribution Company,” MarTech Breakthrough Awards
   

  

 “PR Innovation of the Year,” Gold Stevie® Winner, 2023 American Business Awards
   

  

 “Marketing/Public Relations Solution,” Gold Stevie® Winner, 2023 American Business Awards
   

  

**What’s Next…**
 Qualified candidates will be contacted by a member of our in-house recruitment team to kick-start the recruitment process. If you are a possible fit, you will be invited to meet with a few key individuals in order to help you get a full understanding of the team and the position. Our goal is for you to get to know us as we get to know you!
   

  

**Apply now to join our successful team!**
**Please Note**
 Subject to local legislation, and as applicable to the position to which you have applied, Notified may require your consent at the point of offer to complete certain background screening checks including (but not limited to) Legal right to work in the relevant country, reference checks, Credit checks and Criminal checks. Failure to complete these checks / meet the required criteria may result in offer withdrawal.

title: L1 Support specialist
description:
Hi Professionals,
 



 Greetings From Ampstek!!
 



 Hope you are high in your spirits. Please stay safe.
 



 Our client is looking for
 **L1 Support Specialist** 
 to join a high-growth organization. If you are interested share you resume
 **Sreeja.j@ampstek.com** 




**Role: L1 Support specialist** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Duration: Permanent** 




**Job Description:** 




 Required Skills and Qualifications:
 



 • Mandatory Service Desk or Technical Support role with 5-10 years of experience
 



 • Experience in L1 event monitoring
 



 • Experience in ITIL and ITSM processes - best practices as prescribed by ITIL
 



 • Familiarity with common software applications and troubleshooting techniques.
 



 • Support experience in End User Services - Intune + Patching & Soft. Distribution O365 Collaboration Engineering; Application packaging; D365 Support
 



 • Support experience in Engineering Applications (pi-Digital, PLM Support, CAD); MSFT power apps support, Azure Cloud Ops support
 



 • Manufacturing domain knowledge
 







**Other skills:** 








 • Fluent (Speak, Read, Write) in English and Swedish.
 



 • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 



 • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
 



 • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
 



 • Customer-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality support.
 



 • Communication: This includes both verbal and non-verbal communication, active listening, and clear articulation of ideas.
 



 • Empathy: Understanding and sharing the feelings of others, which builds rapport and fosters trust.
 



 • Emotional Intelligence: Recognizing and managing your own emotions, as well as understanding the emotions of others.
 



 • Conflict Resolution: Effectively handling disagreements and finding solutions that work for everyone involved.
 



 • Negotiation: Collaboratively reaching agreements and compromises with others.
 



 • Teamwork: Working effectively with others towards a common goal, including sharing ideas and supporting each other.
 



 • Leadership: Inspiring and motivating others, and guiding them towards achieving goals.
 



 • Flexibility and Adaptability: Adjusting to different situations and people, and being willing to compromise.
 



 • Patience: Remaining calm and understanding in challenging situations, especially when dealing with difficult personalities.
 



 • Responsibility and Dependability: Being reliable and trustworthy in fulfilling commitments.
 







**Mandatory Qualifications:** 




 Experience with IT service management (ITSM)- Jira Service Management tool
 



  





**Thanks & Regards,** 




**Sreeja** 




**IT Recruiter | Europe & UK** 




**Email - sreeja.j@ampstek.com** 




**Ampstek Services Limited**

title: Manager, Customer Success
description:
Trintech is a multi-award winning cloud-based Fintech provider and we are seeking a results driven, motivated leader that will be responsible for leading Trintech’s Commercial Customer Success team, specifically overseeing the success and satisfaction of customers using the Adra product suite. This individual will be accountable for developing and executing strategies that promote customer advocacy, retention, product adoption, and revenue growth. A strong focus will be placed on scaling customer engagement using digital touch and 1-to-many outreach programs.
 



  





 This role requires a hybrid working schedule of atleast 3 days a week in the Stockholm office.
 



  





**WHAT YOU'LL DO** 



* Team Leadership & Development: Lead, coach, and mentor the Commercial Customer Success team to meet performance goals and deliver outstanding customer experiences.
* Digital Customer Engagement: Design and execute scalable engagement programs (e.g., webinars, automated journeys, group trainings) to drive product adoption and customer success at scale.
* Customer Lifecycle Management: Oversee customer journeys across onboarding, adoption, renewal, and expansion phases with a clear focus on value realization and customer satisfaction.
* Retention & Expansion: Own and drive metrics related to customer retention, renewal, and growth within the Commercial segment.
* Customer Advocacy: Cultivate referenceable customers by encouraging case studies, G2 reviews, and participation in reference programs.
* KPI Ownership & Reporting: Define and monitor KPIs for team performance, customer health, and product usage. Provide regular reporting to leadership on team outcomes and improvement plans.
* Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner closely with Sales, Product, Marketing, and Support to create a unified and consistent customer experience.
* Feedback & Voice of Customer: Utilize NPS, CSAT, and direct customer feedback to inform product development and improve processes.



  





**WHO YOU ARE** 



* Fluent in Swedish and English—both written and spoken.
* Minimum of 3 years' experience leading and managing Customer Success teams within the software or SaaS industry.
* Proven experience managing digital-first customer success models, including 1-to-many communication channels.
* Strong leadership and people management skills, with the ability to inspire and develop high-performing teams.
* Data-driven mindset with strong analytical, reporting, and decision-making skills.
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience in financial and accounting processes and/or relevant degree/certifications preferred.
* Willingness to travel occasionally within the Nordics and internationally as needed.



  





 At our core, Trintechers stand committed to fostering a culture rooted in our core values – Humble, Empowered, Reliable, and Open. Together, these values guide our actions, define our identity, and inspire us to continuously strive for excellence in everything we do.
 



  





*Should you require (or need) accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please provide your requirements to recruiting@trintech.com and we will work with you to accommodate your needs.* 




  





*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

title: CFT Engineer in CoE Integration | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about new technology and making a difference? Join our digital transformation!
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a CFT Engineer You will be a part of a team which supports and maintains integration platform components for SEB globally also work with operations, development, maintenance, and security of the file transfer platform. We work with modern File manage software systems, cloud enabled technologies, modern tools with a sip of mainframe to achieve high productivity. We are 14 people located in Vilnius and Stockholm and working in Agile.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Someone who has good understanding about the various operating systems Unix/Linux/Windows systems
* Integration protocols (eg. FTPS, SFTP, AS2)
* Networking (firewall, routing NAT’ing)
* Experience in API driven automation of enterprise business processes
* Ability to work as a team member
* Service minded and customer oriented
* Self-going, quick learner, motivated, positive and open minded with excellent communication skills
* Willing to share knowledge, help others and accept help
* Strong sense of responsibility and commitment
* Good English language skills


**What We Offer**
* Curious and always ready to help colleagues
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Challenging, cutting-edge work


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025.06.27. If you have questions about the position, please contact Silvija Meliukste via Silvija.meliukste@seb.se or Anton Hänni via anton.hanni@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

*Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.*
**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Program Director
description:
**Overview:** 




 We are seeking a highly experienced Strategic E-Commerce Program Director to lead the planning, execution, and optimisation of a large-scale e-commerce transformation program. In this role, you will oversee cross-functional teams and drive the successful delivery of complex digital commerce initiatives, ensuring scalability, customer-centricity, and sustainable growth in a competitive market.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead end-to-end planning and execution of a major e-commerce transformation program.
* Manage cross-functional teams and coordinate multiple workstreams to ensure seamless program delivery.
* Drive digital transformation initiatives with a strong focus on customer experience, operational excellence, and commercial performance.
* Collaborate with senior stakeholders to align program objectives with strategic business goals.
* Ensure successful implementation of e-commerce modules, including CIAM, Payment, OMS, and related systems.
* Oversee platform selection and implementation, leveraging expertise with platforms such as Commerce Tools, Shopify, Magento, and Salesforce Commerce Cloud.
* Utilize data-driven decision-making to optimize performance and ensure continuous improvement.
* Provide strong leadership, mentorship, and guidance to project managers and cross-functional teams.
* Foster a collaborative culture that encourages innovation, transparency, and accountability.
* Serve as a key point of contact for program status updates and stakeholder management.



  





**Required Skills and Experience:** 



* 20+ years of industry experience, with a strong background in retail and e-commerce.
* Proven success in managing large B2C e-commerce transformation programs at scale.
* Strong analytical, project management, and leadership skills.
* Extensive experience with major e-commerce platforms (e.g., Commerce Tools, Shopify, Magento, Salesforce Commerce Cloud).
* In-depth understanding of e-commerce modules such as CIAM, Payment, OMS, and transformation best practices.
* Familiarity with web analytics, CDPs, and CMS tools.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
* English language proficiency.



  





**Desirable Skills:** 



* Experience working in B2B and B2C commerce environments.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and practices.
* Knowledge of SEO, SEM, CRM, and digital analytics tools.

title: Specialist SE
description:
**Description**
**Salesforce** 
 , the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For seven years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win.
   

  

**Join us!**
**About The Position**
 The Salesforce Marketing Cloud Solutions Engineering team is a diverse group of technology and business process experts that support direct sales to prospects, customers, and partners by creating, packaging, and demonstrating innovative solutions tailored to client needs.
   

  

 Salesforce Marketing Cloud is a market leader in digital marketing, encompassing Data, Advertising, Inbound Marketing (web, mobile), and Outbound marketing (email, SMS, mobile, web, Ads, human touch channels) and their orchestration.
   

  

 The role of the Solution Engineer is to collaborate with the Account Executive in discovery, assess solution fit and commercial opportunity, build a solution and architecture vision, and provide proof through presentations, demos, RFP responses, proof of concepts, and business cases. This includes presenting to various levels within the customer organization, from specialist roles and digital and marketing managers to Director and C-Level executives in General Management, Marketing, and IT.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Proven track record of success with several years of experience in a similar role.
* Experience in B2C industries such as Retail, CPG, Financial Services, Travel & Transport, etc.
* Excellent presentation skills, comfortable presenting to diverse audiences, from a crowd of a thousand to a CMO or two developers.
* Familiarity with running discovery workshops, proof of concepts, and applying design thinking techniques.
* Ability to switch quickly between different modes of thinking and tasks.
* Self-starter who is highly creative and able to manage and prioritize effectively.
* Ability to work with the sales team to understand and present a business case to clients, articulating a technical solution and highlighting business benefits in a language they understand.
* Deep technical expertise in any of the following domains: digital marketing, customer data platforms, advertising, commerce, BI & Analytics, Web analytics, CRM, CMS.
* Knowledge of modern marketing and web technologies.
* Strong conceptual understanding of database design and proficiency in database queries.
* BA/BS preferred or equivalent work experience with demonstrated proficiency.
* Fluent in English + Swedish + Right to Work in Sweden


**It would be great if…**
* You have prior digital marketing experience.
* You have worked for a SaaS computing company.
* You have presented and sold to marketers before.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Join a global tech company dedicated to making digital communication smarter, safer, and more efficient. With over 400 million monthly active users, our AI-powered platform helps protect people from fraud, spam, and unwanted interruptions so they can focus on what matters.
 



 As a Data Engineer, you’ll be part of the Infrastructure team, building a robust, scalable self-service analytics platform that supports fast and reliable data access across the business.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Maintain and enhance ingestion pipelines delivering billions of daily events
* Build and optimize complex ETL workflows
* Partner with teams to improve platform usability and data access
* Contribute to tools, frameworks, and best practices for data development
* Support data scientists and analysts in bringing insights into production
* Explore streaming and ML platform use cases



  





**What You Bring:** 



* 3+ years in data engineering
* Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow)
* Proficiency with Spark (Scala/Python), and cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, or Azure
* Familiarity with CI/CD (Jenkins, Git) and software engineering principles
* Strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills



  





**Why Join Us:** 



* International, agile team with 35+ nationalities
* Competitive salary, 30 days vacation, health insurance, and pension
* Flexible work hours, hybrid setup, and excellent tech gear
* Regular team events, learning days, gym membership, and more

title: Senior Software Architect
description:
**--- PLEASE READ BEFORE APPLYING ---** 




  





**Company Description** 





 Our mission is to put useful AI in the hands of knowledge workers. Quantera is dedicated to changing the way financial research of done. Financial data is scattered, unstructured and not made to be accessible. Insights from simplifying complex data to helping our customers make informed decisions. Based in Stockholm, our mission is to provide accessible and actionable information to empower individual investors.
 




  





**Job Type:** 





 Full time/Half time
 




  





**Job Location:** 





 Stockholm, Sweden
 




  





**Who you are:** 





 We're seeking a seasoned talented engineer to help build our cutting-edge AI workflow management platform. An ideal candidate has deep expertise in building modern and scalable backend solutions, dipped your toes into modern AI technologies and AI agents.
 




  





**Qualifications:** 



* Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, AI/ML, or a related field.
* 7+ years of experience in software engineering with 3+ years in senior or architectural roles
* Deep expertise in building modern, scalable backend solutions using languages like Python,
 
 TypeScript
 
 , Java, or similar.
* Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerisation technologies (Docker etc)
* Solid understanding of Micro services architecture, API design and databases.
* Work closely with our cross-functional team, including design, product, and business units.
* Contribute innovative ideas for future development.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Design and architect scalable, resilient backend systems for our AI workflow management platform
* Define technical standards, best practices, and development guidelines for the engineering team
* Lead architectural decisions for data processing pipelines handling large volumes of financial data



**Technical Leadership** 



* Collaborate with product and engineering teams to translate business requirements into robust technical solutions
* Drive technical discussions and decision-making processes across cross-functional teams
* Champion engineering excellence through code reviews, documentation, and knowledge sharing



**Platform Development** 



* Build and optimize high-performance backend services using modern technologies and frameworks
* Implement robust data ingestion and processing systems for unstructured financial information
* Ensure system reliability, security, and performance at scale.
* Excellence in technical communication and documentation.



  





**Bonus Points (We really like a good startup mindset):** 



* Done the 0 - 1 journey before in a fast growing startup/scale up.
* Experience in fintech, financial services, or financial data processing.
* Be driven and take initiatives with personal projects and launching anything out into the world.



  






 \*This role is not salaried, we are a startup who will raise funding when the time is right. Compensation is equity-based only as of today. You will be at the forefront of an AI-first Fintech company aimed at building the best-in-class tools for our customers.
 




  






 We are a small team, everyone at Quantera is a builder no matter the experience, we make music from a few notes and have learned the art of getting more from less. As we are in our infancy, ready to take on the giants! Are you ready to take the challenge?
 




  





*Quantera is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity & inclusion.*

title: Solution Specialist
description:
Do you want to join an agile and pioneering team that supports our function with new initiatives as well as operations? At Sandvik Group IT we’re now looking for a Solution Specialist to join us in driving innovation and shaping our digital future – welcome!
   

  

 Your mission
   

  

 As our Solution Specialist, you play a leading role within your team as you work with our technical aspects and cloud-based data platforms. You collaborate with other team members, departments and vendors to provide technical support, follow up on financial progress, implement operational changes and ensure efficient communication and problem solving. To ensure compliance with organizational policies and standards, you develop and maintain technical documentation, procedures and user manuals.
   

  

 Included in your mission:
   

  

* Ensure operations and delivery of assigned scope of technology.
* Provide support to install, configure, deploy and maintain enterprise-level applications and systems.
* Drive cross-functional dependencies to ensure operational stability.
* Monitor platform performance and identify issues that could impact application performance.
* Keep up to date with asset and configuration items.
* Troubleshoot and resolve application issues and maintain accurate documentation of problems and their solutions.


 The location for this position is Sandviken or Stockholm and we offer you a hybrid work solution.
   

  

 Your character
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with previous experience working in similar roles. You have experience in IT operations and change management, as well as technical knowledge of cloud and SaaS solutions. You’re technically focused and take initiatives to suggest opportunities for improvements and solve problems to achieve goals. As we’re a global organization, you need excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
   

  

 Although your background is important, your personality is your biggest asset in this role. You’re self-motivated and enjoy taking ownership and being in charge to drive things forward. You’re curious to learn more and grow as a person and can work independently, while also being a team player with collaboration skills and an agile mindset. With excellent communication skills, you’re able to build relationships based on trust and transparency.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Joakim Wallin, hiring manager, +46 (0)70-616 06 53.
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contact in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Malena Rackner, Unionen, +46 (0)70 242 33 90
* Tord Engström, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 106 62 87
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Therese Rutqvist
   

  

**How To Apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment. Please send your application as soon as possible and no later than June 11th, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0079765.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
Do you want to help take Tre's customer communication to the next level through personalized, automated experiences? We've come a long way in our automation journey – systems are in place, the team is highly engaged, and much of the groundwork is done. We're looking for someone to help scale and accelerate our progress.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a MAS you'll develop our 1-2-1 communication (SMS, email, push), focusing on automation, personalization, and customer value. You'll drive strategy and daily operations, translating our MA strategy into concrete flows, improvements, and working methods. The role includes operationally driving AI initiatives and projects where you contribute insights and trends in digitalization.
   

  

 You'll work closely with IT, BI, and analytics to support data integration and technical development. A key part of the role is challenging and guiding stakeholders as we continue our automation journey, ensuring that our solutions follow MA principles and deliver real customer and business impact. You will also be responsible for MA follow up metrics, implement A/B testing and other optimization methods. And in alignment with other stakeholders regularly track, manage and share different goals and KPI’s for analysis, and insights.
   

  

**You will look forward to**
* take on a key role that makes a difference in our automation journey
* work cross-functionally with IT and our other experts in the business
* working at a company that delivers critical infrastructure where your contribution directly contributes to societal benefits
* being part of Sweden's best workplaces according to Great Place To Work and that we are proud partners of Women in Tech and Tjejer Kodar


 ,
   

  

**We believe you are**
 An experienced professional who has worked with automated digital flows, ideally within marketing automation. You have a strategic mindset regarding automation's role in the customer journey, and you know how to break down complex requirements into clear and manageable deliverables.
   

  

 You have great knowledge about Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and you understand how systems and integrations influence performance and user experience. You are confident working in agile teams with ceremonies like backlog refinement and sprint planning. It's a plus if you've worked with Customer Data Platforms (CDP). You also know how to use data insights to improve communication. We see it as a bonus if you have worked practically with AI.
   

  

 You're a skilled communicator who collaborates well across functions. You can support and challenge when needed. You are fluent in English, and Swedish is considered a plus.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 We are accepting applications through this advertisement and will hold interviews on an ongoing basis. A cover letter is not required, but we would like you to attach a CV and answer the questions we have asked below when you apply. We use tests to ensure objective assessments are connected with selection. The position may be filled before the application deadline. Background checks are carried out on the final candidate.

title: Storage & Backup Engineer
description:
Vi söker en Storage & Backup Engineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.
   

  

 Som Engineer med inriktning mot storage och backup kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i uppbyggnaden av Bankgirots nya lagringsinfrastruktur. Vi har valt moderna och skalbara enterprise-lösningar med fokus på enkelhet, säkerhet och framtidssäkring. Då många av systemen är Microsoft-baserade, ser vi gärna att du har en bakgrund inom Microsoft-miljöer.
   

  

**Din roll**
 I rollen kommer du att ansvara för att implementera nya lagrings- och arkivlösningar, anpassade efter olika datatyper och verksamhetsbehov – från användardata till säkerhetsloggar och affärskritisk information. Rollen kräver förmåga att förstå och hantera domänspecifika krav, t.ex. när objektlagring ska införas eller hur långsiktig arkivering bäst utformas.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden omfattar bl a
   

  

  

* Implementation och vidareutveckling av enterprise-, storage- och backup-lösningar
* Införande av nya arkiv- och lagringslösningar utifrån verksamhetens databehov
* Hantering av block-, objekt- och filbaserad lagring (SAN/NAS)
* Incidenthantering, förändringshantering och daglig drift av lagringsmiljöer
* Automatisering och integration via t.ex. Ansible (Infrastructure as Code)
* Dokumentation och uppföljning av lösningar och processer
* Deltagande i planering och kravställning för framtida lagringsarkitektur


**Vem är du**
 Du drivs av att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du kan vara med och forma och implementera lösningar och förbättringar. Du har djup teknisk kunskap inom ditt område och arbetar strukturerat och analytiskt för att driva utveckling. Du strävar efter att leverera högkvalitativa resultat med säkerhet i fokus.
   

  

 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen ser vi att du har en god problemlösningsförmåga för att bidra till att skapa nya och bättre lösningar. Vi ser också att har god kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga och ser vikten av goda samarbeten såväl internt som extern. Du har även goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit. Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller 0730821230 eller Amanda Eksell: amanda.eksell@nexergroup.com eller +46 707 434 173.
   

  

 Läs mer om tjänsten här.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Network Technician NSXT
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Har du goda kunskaper inom nätverksvirtualisering från Cisco och VMware? Vill du använda din kompetens för att göra skillnad för framtidens nätverksinfrastruktur?
   

  

 Jag heter Greg Szuh och jag ansvarar för grupperingen Managed Network. Här har vi samlat tekniska specialister, arkitekter och tjänsteägare för området nätverk och vi är navet av Telia Cygates driftaffär för nätverk. Just nu söker vi en medarbetare inom Nätverk med inriktning Datacenter som har vilja och engagemang att utvecklas tillsammans med oss.
   

  

**Din nästa utmaning?**
 Du kommer att arbeta som Nätverkstekniker för en central grupp som jobbar med utgångspunkt från våra Datacenter-tjänster inom Managed Services.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du arbeta operativt med lösningar med fokus på våra datacenter innefattande uppgifter såsom drift och förvaltning, samt projekt såsom on och offboarding av kunder och tjänster. Arbetsmoment såsom konfiguration, uppsättning och felsökning av underlay/overlay-tekniker (samt tillhörande säkerhetslösningar) tillhör vardagen.
   

  

 Du arbetar både på egen hand och i team, och fungerar som en central kontaktpunkt inom nätverksgrupperingen mot andra avdelningar. När vi arbetar med kund spänner leveransen ofta över flera områden, såsom säkerhet, Cloud, automation, virtualisering och compute/storage. Om du på sikt vill certifiera dig inom ett eller flera områden så är det något vi stödjer.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som person motiveras du av att leverera kvalitet till våra slutkunder och kommer särskilt till din rätt när du får utmana med nya tankar och idéer. Du involverar och håller kunder som kollegor informerade genom att kommunicera på ett tydligt och enkelt sätt, och söker aktivt feedback för att förbättra ditt arbete och vår leverans.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet:**
* troligtvis 5 år eller mer arbetslivserfarenhet inom nätverk/säkerhet.
* troligtvis Cisco-certifiering på Professional-nivå eller har motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Mycket goda kunskaper och förståelse för multitenant-lösningar inom nät- och serverdrift
* Mycket goda kunskaper virtualisering inom VMware (NSX-T) och vCloud Director.
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska
* Arbetat enligt ITIL-ramverk


**Extra meriterande är om arbetat med något av nedanstående:**
* God kunskap kring VXLAN
* God kunskap kring Fortinet brandväggar
* Erfarenhet med automation via Ansible mfl.


**Home of Experts**
 Telia Cygate har länge varit kända som en IT-partner som har nätverk och säkerhet i sitt DNA. Sedan 2006 är vi en del av Telia Company, vilket ger oss en stabil grund att stå på för att hjälpa våra kunder att utforska möjligheterna med digitalisering och molntjänster på ett tryggt sätt.
   

  

 Men det handlar inte bara om vad vi gör, utan minst lika mycket om hur vi gör det: Med ett leende och alltid med kundens bästa för ögonen. Vi tar med oss kompetens och glädje till alla möten, för vi vet att det är idéerna och mångfalden som bidrar till de mest hållbara lösningarna. Tillsammans gör vi det enkelt och roligt att vara människa i teknikens värld.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Vi lovar att du kommer att börja en spännande resa hos oss samtidigt som du har mycket roligt på vägen. Placeringsort är flexibelt. Om du har några frågor så får du gärna kontakta mig Greg Szuh på 072–7266534 eller gergely.szuh@cygate.se eller på Linkedin.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroller är en del av vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Du behöver ha svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of your next big opportunity!**

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
**Data Platform Architect till Sogeti Stockholm.**
 Vi på Sogeti vågar påstå att vi är ett av de mest framåtlutade konsultföretagen när det gäller Data, Analytics och AI. Vi driver transformationsprojekt tillsammans med våra strategiska kunder, alltifrån nya ekosystem av tjänster och samarbeten kring avancerad analys av satellitbilder, till införande av moderna dataplattformar hos multinationella företag.
   

  

**Din roll:**
 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren Dataplattformsarkitekt och som är grym på att vägleda kring och skapa skalbara, robusta och moderna dataplattformar. Vi söker dig som brinner för att skapa värde för våra kunder och som både kan leda och vara "hands-on" i att designa, bygga, migrera till och optimera dataplattformar. Vi söker dig som kombinerar djup teknisk kompetens med en stark kommunikativ förmåga.
   

  

**I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:**
* Designa, implementera och optimera dataplattformar.
* Arbeta med dataarkitektur och datamodellering till säkerhetsmodeller och datastyrning.
* Skapa lösningsförslag, leda implementationer och säkerställa kvalitet i leveranserna.
* Val av teknologier och verktyg, definiera scheman och etablera datastyrningspraxis för att säkerställa säker och skalbar arkitektur.
* Bygga och underhålla ETL-flöden, extrahera, transformera och ladda data från olika källor med fokus på pålitlighet och effektivitet.
* Implementera säkerhetspolicys och säkerställa att plattformen följer dataskyddsregler som GDPR.
* Utveckla strategier för datalagring och optimering för snabb åtkomst och kostnadseffektivitet.
* Stödja flera datakällor, designa framtidssäkra lösningar för datahantering, dataflöden och integrationer.
* Presentera tekniska lösningar på ett engagerande sätt för olika målgrupper.
* Bygga och leda team samt driva leveranser mot uppsatta mål.


**Din profil:**
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och leda migrering, införande och förvaltning av dataplattformslösningar.
* Erfarenhet av tekniker som Teradata, Databricks, Snowflake, Synapse, Ab Initio, Mainframe, Informatica, PowerCenter, PowerShell, SQL, Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Data Fabric, ETL, Power BI och DataOps.
* Förmåga att agera rådgivande och driva diskussioner med olika intressenter, både under införande och i leveranser.
* Passion för data och tekniska lösningar och en vilja att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt.
* Stark lagspelare med förmåga att samarbeta i tvärfunktionella agila team.
* Självständig, initiativrik och en problemlösare som balanserar detaljer med helhetsperspektiv.
* Tala och skriva flytande svenska och engelska.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
**Innovativ miljö:** 
 Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
   

  

**Karriärutveckling** 
 : Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

**Flexibelt arbete:** 
 Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
   

  

**Teamkänsla:** 
 Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.
   

  

**Ansökan:**
 Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Johan Alsén på johan.alsen@sogeti.se
   

  

 Genväg för snabb kontakt innan du ansöker? Självklart! Vi är bara två klick och ett micro-formulär bort. Första klicket
 **klicket här** 
 och du är igång.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Epassi** 
**is an innovative fintech company, our** 
**purpose is to boost everyday well-being** 
 .
   

  

 We are the market leader in mobile payments for employee benefits in Northern Europe – our solution combines all the benefits into a single mobile app. Epassi’s team is made of highly skilled people from top notch business developers, designers and software engineers to passionate sales, marketing, and customer support professionals (a total of almost 300 employees). Epassi is awarded by the Financial Times as one of the fastest growing companies in Europe.
   

  

*Epassi expands outside the Nordics - acquires the UK's largest health and fitness network
 **Incorpore Ltd,** 
 leading Italian corporate welfare and employee benefits company
 **Eudaimon S.p.A &
 *Exercite,***
 a leading corporate fitness network in \_Germany* 
 and the Netherlands\_
   

  

**Data Engineer - Helsinki, Stockholm, Bremen or Hamburg**
 Are you passionate about creating robust data solutions which empower data-driven decision-making? Do you want to be part of influencing the well-being of employees with the help of data and analytics for millions of Epassi users? Do you want to be part of a rapidly growing company?
   

  

 If yes, you might be a great fit for us. Read more below and apply to join Epassi!
   

  

**As a Data Engineer**
* You will be developing and maintaining a hybrid data platform (on-prem & cloud)
* You will be building data integrations between various data sources and the data platform
* You will be implementing high-quality data solutions in compliance with privacy regulations and security standards
* You will be working in co-operation with other teams, such as IT, security, software development, business, and finance
* You will be part of an agile team of data & analytics professionals and will be contributing to continuous improvement of our way-of-working


**You Will Be a Great Fit If You Have**
* 5+ years as a data engineer building, developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines
* Hands-on experience of formal DataOps/DevOps practices and Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible
* Solid foundation in AWS, particularly in data storage solutions
* Experience of Airflow and Databricks/Spark
* Proficiency in SQL and Python programming
* Good communication and social skills
* Working proficiency in English


**Why You Should Join Epassi**
* We are a fast-growing tech company; you will have a chance to impact on many meaningful things and grow together with us as a professional
* We have an inspiring & supportive culture, and we take care of the wellbeing of our employees
* We provide a flexible hybrid work model and care about your work-life balance
* We take care of the professional development of Epassians by creating a personal development plan individually and supporting development by providing a yearly budget
* We have a unique team environment - international, motivated, supportive colleagues with a great sense of humor
* Epassi has a great benefit package, for example wellbeing and lunch benefit, healthy snacks & refreshments at the office, investment in employee growth and development, and private health care


 If you want to ask more information about this opportunity, please
   

  

 contact careers@epassi.com.

title: Manager, Sales Engineering (Remote)
description:
As a global leader in cybersecurity, CrowdStrike protects the people, processes and technologies that drive modern organizations. Since 2011, our mission hasn’t changed — we’re here to stop breaches, and we’ve redefined modern security with the world’s most advanced AI-native platform. Our customers span all industries, and they count on CrowdStrike to keep their businesses running, their communities safe and their lives moving forward. We’re also a mission-driven company. We cultivate a culture that gives every CrowdStriker both the flexibility and autonomy to own their careers. We’re always looking to add talented CrowdStrikers to the team who have limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to our customers, our community and each other. Ready to join a mission that matters? The future of cybersecurity starts with you.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At CrowdStrike, our Pre Sales Engineers provide the technical knowledge, experience and understanding to allow existing and new customers and partners to gain maximum value from our technology, from building world-class Security Operation Centres to acute post-breach response. The Pre Sales Manager leads this team, providing inspiration, guidance, training, development and assistance to drive the business forward.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 You will be expected to build, develop and retain a strong team in a rapidly growing and evolving company. You’ll undoubtedly be required to recruit new team members to support the company growth, so you will need both a strong industry network and an excellent ability to work hand in hand with our recruitment team. However, you’ll also need to build from within, helping SEs in your team raise and refine their skills, implementing training programs and mentoring across the team.
   

  

 Your partners will be the Regional Directors of Sales for Nordics. You will need to be joined at the hip, planning and executing together on a shared vision. In region you’ll also be partnered with a number of Marketing, Channel and other leaders, each with their own needs. To succeed, you will need to have a set of open, transparent relationships, building on mutual trust with each of these functions.
   

  

 Building wider relationships is also going to be key; Pre Sales can’t operate without the Post Sales team, so you will also be working with the Technical Account Management and Support Managers to ensure a great handover of existing accounts and ongoing management. You will need to have an open dialogue with your peers in our Reseller Partners, SIs, MSSPs, Store Partners and Technical Partners (3rd party vendors etc). Finally, you’ll provide input back to the Product Management, Product Marketing Management and CTO team on future product and service developments your team discovers in the field, especially competitive intelligence.
   

  

 The technical, commercial, communication and negotiation skills needed to accomplish team goals won’t always be provided by others. While you will spend a lot of time coaching, you will also need to directly involve yourself in the most complex and valuable opportunities. To do this well you will need to bring industry knowledge and experience and the ability and willingness to do the job of a Pre Sales Engineer from time to time. In short, sometimes you just roll up your sleeves and get stuck in.
   

  

 In addition, you will work alongside Marketing and have opportunities to present at industry conferences and marketing events, promoting the CrowdStrike brand and technology as well as your own capabilities.
   

  

**What You'll Need**
* Pre-sales/technical experience within networking and/or security
* Planning and organisational skills
* Ability to influence departmental management teams
* Proven problem solving skills
* Experience in working with channel partners
* Experience working in an IT security business
* Familiarity with various hacking and exploitation tools and methodologies, common malware families, and Anti-Virus / IDS / IPS evasion techniques
* Leadership skills with the ability to prioritize and execute in a methodical and disciplined manner. Set and manage expectations with senior stake-holders and team members
* Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to present to a variety of external audiences, including being able to interact with senior executives
* A willingness to be challenged and a strong desire to learn
* Must be prepared to travel to client meetings where necessary
* Line management experience, including managing teams remotely
* Security certifications, CISSP, CISM, Security+, CEH, etc


**Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike**
* Remote-friendly and flexible work culture
* Market leader in compensation and equity awards
* Comprehensive physical and mental wellness programs
* Competitive vacation and holidays for recharge
* Paid parental and adoption leaves
* Professional development opportunities for all employees regardless of level or role
* Employee Resource Groups, geographic neighbourhood groups and volunteer opportunities to build connections
* Vibrant office culture with world class amenities
* Great Place to Work Certified™ across the globe


 CrowdStrike is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone is valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. We support veterans and individuals with disabilities through our affirmative action program.
   

  

 CrowdStrike is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment. The Company does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, creed, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy or pregnancy-related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance, or any other characteristic protected by law. We base all employment decisions--including recruitment, selection, training, compensation, benefits, discipline, promotions, transfers, lay-offs, return from lay-off, terminations and social/recreational programs--on valid job requirements.
   

  

 If you need assistance accessing or reviewing the information on this website or need help submitting an application for employment or requesting an accommodation, please contact us at recruiting@crowdstrike.com for further assistance.

title: IT-arkitekt Nivå 5
company_industry: Computer Networking Products and Software Development
description:
**Plats** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

**Omfattning** 
 : 100% första året, därefer minst 50%
   

  

**Uppdragslängd** 
 : 2 år med möjlighet till förlängning upp till ytterligare 24 månader
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren IT- arkitekt (nivå 5) till ett strategiskt och samhällsviktigt uppdrag inom offentlig sektor.
   

  

**Hvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
* Ansvara för strategisk arkitektur och tekniska vägval
* Utforma målarkitekturer, teknisk roadmap samt lösningsförslag
* Säkerställa att arkitekturen uppfyller krav på datakvalitet, interoperabilitet och säkerhet
* Agera rådgivare till ledning och styrgrupper
* Förankra arkitekturbeslut med både teknisk personal och verksamhet
* Stötta och leda andra arkitekter samt driva arkitektforum

**Job Requirements**
